This will increase the income of the family, and Namig will reinvest the profit in family agricultural activities. He awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for heating the greenhouse.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Eman prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Eman is a 38-year-old married mother of three children from Al Khaledieh, Jordan. Now requesting a 600 JOD loan to buy clothing to sell, in the future she is planning to expand her enterprise and have her own shop in order to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her retail business.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: A 57-year-old married woman, Ry has been supporting her family of three children via her two-hectare rice-cropping operation. Besides helping on the rice field, her husband also works as a quarry worker. Ry has been in this business for 20 years. She has never been involved with Kiva partner VisionFund before, but is now seeking her first loan in the amount of 700 US dollars in order to buy fertilizer and a decent motorbike for supporting her business as well as for commuting. She hopes that she can generate a high yield and high profits, and that she can obtain a better standard of living than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a decent motorbike

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is from Khashuri district. She is 48 years old and lives with her large family: her husband, two sons, two daughters-in-law, four grandchildren and a father-in-law, a pensioner. Nino’s husband and the younger son work at Georgian Railway and receive monthly salaries.

Nino runs the family agricultural business. In particular, the family cultivates a plot of land where haricots and capers are grown. Besides that, the family is involved in the animal husbandry business and has a milk cow, a calf and two oxen. Nino milks the cow and produces dairy products which are sold at the local open market. She works hard to make some money for savings and to improve the family's living conditions.

Nino requested credit for expansion of the dairy farm. She will purchase an additional milk cow, doubling the amount of milk sold. The family will have more income and will be able to provide better care for their children, as well as improve the family's overall living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase another milk cow

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Maryam prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband.

Maryam is a 32-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi in Jordan. She has two children. She requested a 400 JOD loan to buy a sewing machine to make clothes. in the future, Maryam is planning to open her own shop and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for making and sewing clothes.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Tamara prefers that her photo is not on the internet; thus, the above photo is of her father. Tamara is a 19-year-old single woman from Al Russeifeh Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to buy clothes for children, women and brides, in order to resell the clothes to friends and neighbors in the same area. She hopes in the future to expand her project by opening a shop. Since Tamara is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Marizel

texts.en: Despite financial difficulty, Marizel aims to become financially stable in the future. She is 35 years old and single. She runs a general store in the community, selling different grocery items. She has been operating the business for almost ten years and usually earns a profit of PHP12,000 a month, which she utilizes for her personal use and support of her parents who are now dependent on her. She planned to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand. But due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP10,000 to buy rice, soft drinks, beverages, canned goods, noodles, soaps and seasonings for resale. Through hard work, she believes that she can able to improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, beverages, canned goods, noodles, soaps and seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Nijilo Felex

texts.en:
Nijilo  is a 38 year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of two and nine.  One of them goes to school.

Nijilo runs a bakery and has been in business for three years. He has one employee. He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is taking a loan of 4000sdg to purchase flour and other supplies.  He has no source of income other than this business. In five years, Nijilo would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices.

Nijilo says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more flour for making breads, cake, etc.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en:
Ilhomjon is 35 years old and he is a hardworking man, with a great desire to progress in life. His life partner is a teacher, and they have three children. They live in the house he has succeeded in building, thanks to his great dedication.

Ilhomjon is one of the successful businessmen in his town. For more than ten years, he has been busy selling food items. Also, he has premises for a car wash, but he does not have enough money to buy equipment for developing his business. He is asking for a loan of $3,000 to buy equipment for his car wash service. He promises to make his payment on time. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his car wash service.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Nancy prefers that her photo is not on the internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband.

Nancy is a 35-year-old married woman from Irbid in Jordan. She has four children. Nancy requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses. in the future, Nancy is planning to do further improvements, especially to the backyard, and to buy a computer.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Sana'a

texts.en: Sana'a is a 35-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 900 JD to pay for home improvements: she wants to buy new furniture and some households items. She hopes in the future to expand her home and to benefit from another loan.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Microempresarios Emprendedores Group

texts.es: Cordiales saludos!! Este es el grupo “Microempresarios Emprendedores” conformado por 06 socios que con el trascurso del tiempo han ido mejorando sus negocios, con la finalidad  de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus  familias. Flora es separada con 05 hijos independientes. A sus 66 años Flora ha llegado a cumplir algunos de sus metas como mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos en su educación.  Actualmente se dedica a la venta de papa rellena, gelatinas y refrescos, la cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente,  lleva en este negocio hace más de 03 años. Solicito el crédito para invertir en su negocio en la compra de azúcar, gelatinas, frutas y aceite. Poner un kiosco donde pueda ofrecer sus productos es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Microempresarios Emprendedores” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Flora es la primera del lado derecho viste chompa negra y polo blanco.
texts.en:
Greetings! This is the group "Microempresarios Emprendedores" (Enterprising Micro-entrepreneurs). It is made up of six members who, as time goes by, have been improving their businesses with the goal of giving their families a better quality of life.

Flora is separated with five independent children. At 66 years of age, Flora has managed to achieve some of her goals, such as improving her home and helping her children with their education. She currently makes a living by selling papa rellena (deep-fried stuffed potatoes), Jell-O, and soft drinks. Her business is mobile and she has had it for more than three years. She is requesting this loan so she can invest in her business by buying sugar, gelatin, fruit, and oil. To set up a kiosk where she can sell her products is her greatest wish.

The group "Microempresarios Emprendedores" thanks the people who made this loan possible. Flora is the first from the right. She is wearing a black sweater and a white polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy sugar, gelatin, fruit, and oil.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is from Khashuri District. She is 24 years old and lives with her parents and two sisters.

The family earns their living through an agricultural business. In particular, they run a small dairy farm of three calves and three milk cows, whose milk is used for dairy products. In addition, they cultivate family-owned land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown; the harvested products are used for family needs. Besides this, Irma owns two pigs and produces hay for feeding the cattle.

Irma’s father serves the local people as a driver, with his own bus, and has a monthly income. The bus is old already and Irma requested a loan to purchase a minibus for him. This will give her father the opportunity to pay lower fuel costs and comfortably serve the local people. The family income will increase and they will be able to expand their agricultural business, as well as improve the family's living conditions. Irma awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus for her father's transportation service

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Due to hardship, Emilia engages in buying dried fish and smoked fish that she resells in the community through house-to-house delivery. She is 47 years old and has two school-age children. She and her husband have aimed to strengthen their sources of living so that they will generate sufficient income to satisfy their basic needs and finance the schooling of their children. In this regard, Emilia has aimed to increase her product offerings to earn higher income. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy  additional stocks of dried fish and smoked fish for resale. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business and hopes that someday, she will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dried fish and smoked fish for resale

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Noor is a 30-year-old married woman from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan. She has one family member. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to buy clothes for children and women to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. She hopes in the future to increase her products and to open a shop to show her products.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jad

texts.en: Jad is a 31-year-old married man with four family members, living in Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan. Jad is requesting a loan of 700 JOD to pay for his home improvements: he wants to buy a washing machine to improve his living standards. He hopes in the future to buy new electronics .

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements.

loans.name: Carlota Floricelda

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente en Portoviejo  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 15 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar vive la señora Carlota, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Doña Carlota para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes y ciertos productos de bazar y papelería,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando pueden y están desocupados, pero por lo general es ella la que mas pasa en su negocio ya que  que es allí donde le gusta estar porque además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se entera de las novedades que pasan a sus alrededor. Tiene más de 15 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar productos de primera necesidad, de bazar y papelería. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos ciclos  y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the seaside resort of San Clemente in Protoviejo, every 15 days the communal bank 15 de Diciembre meets. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many local and foreign tourists. It offers a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of foods typical to the region.

Carlota lives in this place. She is 46 years old, married, and from this relationship she has three children. They are all adults. One of them still lives with her. Her husband works in agriculture.

To get ahead, Carlota has a store in her home with her family. There she sells all kinds of products like: rice, sugar, oils, detergents, and certain stationery and paper products. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m., and sometimes until later. Her son and her husband help her in her work when they can and are free, but generally it is she who spends the most time in her business since it is there where she likes to be. This is because as well as making a living, she entertains herself and learns about the news that happens around her. She has been with her business more than 15 years and doing very well.

She will use this loan to stock her store. She is going to buy products of first necessity, of stationery, and paper products. She has been with the communal bank for two cycles and she likes it because she has made more friends in the group.

Her goal is to continue ahead in her business and that her business grows more every day.

loans.use: to buy products of first necessity, of stationery, and paper products.

loans.name: Abdumavlon

texts.en:
Abdumavlon is married and has five children. His children Zayniddin, Shoira, Ziyovuddin, Gulmira and Gulnora are adults. Abdumavlon is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life for his children. He began his own business dealing in animal husbandry 20 years ago. He works hard, but his income is not enough to rebuild his house. 

Two years ago, Abdumavlon began to build a new house for his children. He has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni (TJS) to buy building materials such as wood and cement for rebuilding his house. He hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve his family's living condition.

loans.use: To buy building materials as wood and cement for rebuilding his house

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is an 18-year-old single woman from Marka in Jordan. She requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for selling grocery items and cosmetics from her own home. In the future, Rawan is planning to open her own shop and buy a car.

Since Rawan is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for selling grocery items and cosmetics.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 27-year-old married woman with one family member and is from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to buy cosmetic products to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. She hopes to increase her products and expand her project by opening a shop in the future. 

Since Huda is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia is 47 years old, married and has three school-age children. She owns and manages a general store in the community to help her husband in earning income. Due to financial constraints, she has aimed to improve her store to earn higher income. She has planned to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand. To work out her plan, she is asking for additional capital in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks for resale. She mentioned that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to improve the business and is hoping that she will be successful in carrying out her plans.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Nansi

texts.en: Nansi is a 31-year-old married woman who has two family members and is from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for home improvements: she wants to buy new furniture and some households items. She hopes in the future to benefit from another loan and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Tawfeq

texts.en: Tawfeq is a 43-year-old married man from Marka in Jordan. He has two children. Tawfeq requested a 1,500 JOD loan to pay for buying spare parts for his car repair shop. In the future, Tawfeq is planning to expand his project and open a new shop. Also, he would like to pay the education expenses of his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car repair shop.

loans.name: Tatimalap Group

texts.en:
Fatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Gbenebu village about 58 years ago. She is married and the couple has seven children who are no longer attending school. Fatu sells firewood and has been doing this business for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Fatu and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Fatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,500,000) to buy piles of firewood to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy more firewood

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 53-year-old married woman who has two family members and is from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to pay for materials for embroidery, so that she can make embroidery to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. She wants to increase her family income.

loans.use: to pay for materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Amani prefers that her photo is not on the internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband.

Amani is a 23-year-old married woman from Hay Nazal in Jordan. She has three children. Amani requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for selling clothes from her own home. In the future, Amani is planning to expand her project and buy a house.

Since Amani is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for selling clothing.

loans.name: Raida

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Raida prefers that her photo is not on the internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. Raida is a 43-year-old married woman from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for home improvements: she wants to do maintenance of the home and to repaint her home. She hopes in the future to buy new furniture.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Due to lack of job opportunities, Nelia decided to start a business to generate income. She is 30 years old and single. She buys and sells motorcycle parts and accessories in the community. Nelia has aimed to improve the business and increase her income to save for her future and to support the schooling of her younger brothers. She has planned to acquire additional stocks of motorcycle parts and accessories, but she does not have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy additional stocks of motorcycle parts and accessories for resale. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business and is hoping that someday, she will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of motorcycle parts and accessories for resale.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Rana prefers that her photo is not on the internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. Rana is a 29-year-old married woman who has three family members and is from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for home improvements: she wants to do maintenance of the home and to improve the rooms. She hopes in the future to provide a good environment for her family to live in.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Ha's Group

texts.en:
Ha was born in 1978. She has two children who are in kindergarten and primary school. Her husband is a driver. Ha sells beverages to earn a living. She gets 4,000,000 VND a month from her business activities. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy a refrigerator to sell ice cream. Her dream is for her children to have good careers.

Other members which are part of Ha's Group include the following:

Hong is 38 years old. She has three children. She cooks food to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy glassware to contain cooked food.
 
Thuy is 29 years old. She has two children. She sells beverages to earn a living. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy a sugarcane juice machine.

Lam is 37 years old. She has two children. She sells food for a living. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy a fried duck machine.

Hue is 26 years old. She has one child. She sells beverages for a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy a blender.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to sell ice cream.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children - one child is currently in school. For the past 8 years, Jane has been working hard to manage her plastic warehouse, which sells plastic cups, plates, and other plastic items. 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more plastic items to sell, and will help Jane to generate greater profits and diversify income to start poultry farming. Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to construct a commercial building. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more plastic items to sell.

loans.name: Royal Sisters Group

texts.en:
This is 55-year-old Pfungwa from Mutare, the capital of Minicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is married and has five children. 

Pfungwa runs an agriculture business producing poultry. The business has been in operation for 2 years. She says the main challenge faced is that some of the chicks can experience health issues. 

Pfungwa has requested a loan of $600 to purchase chicks (baby chickens) and stock feed. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. In the future Pfungwa, plans to expand capacity to raise 500 chicks.

loans.use: to purchase chicks (baby chickens) and stock feed.

loans.name: Nikesi

texts.en:
Nikesi is widowed and has one grown up child. She lives in her own house in the coastal region of Kenya.

She earns income selling khangas. She works more than 8 hours daily selling at the market. What she earns she must use to cover her food, utilities, and medical expenses since she does not have medical insurance. She needs the loan to buy more khangas to sell for cash and on credit to improve her income.

Nikesi’s dream is to increase her income and to have a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy more khangas to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 38-year-old man from Kisumu City. He is married to Elizabeth and they have two children aged three and seven.

Moses operates a tailoring business, a business he has operated for the last seven years. He makes a monthly income of KES. 10,000. Moses is an old client of KADET LTD since he is starting his fourth loan cycle, which he will use to purchase fabric, threads, and other items. 

He will use the expected profits to buy more stock of fabric. His dream is to be prosperous in his business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, threads, and other items.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 24-year-old lady from Kisumu City. She is married to Michael and they have two children, aged eight and five.

Eunice has operated a tailoring business for the last three years and is able to generate a monthly income of KES. 5,000. She joined KADET LTD recently and she has applied for her first loan which she will use to buy fabric for dressmaking. Her profits will be used to buy more fabric.

Her dream is to expand her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy fabric for dressmaking.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en: Rael is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be a business-minded woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in an ideal business environment  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business . She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits to resell. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Gbampo Group

texts.en:
Sonie is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Sonie was born in Makeni city about 50 years ago. She is married to a former military officer, and the couple has five children, one of whom is still attending school. 

For seven years now, Sonie has been selling cooked rice with sauce. With the help of this loan, Sonie and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently, improve their living conditions. Sonie will use her share of the loan (1,200,000 SLL) to expand her business by buying cooking ingredients like rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), tomatoes, onions, pepper, etc., in bulk in order to stop buying retail. With these items in bulk, she can now produce a larger quantity of rice and sauce for sale.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like rice, palm oil, tomatoes, onions, pepper, etc., in bulk in order to stop buying retail.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Mrganush village in the Ararat region with her husband, son, and daughter. Anahit works as an accountant in the neighbouring Vardashen village school. In addition, she helps her husband to run a farm, where they keep livetock, cultivate cabbage, and grow fruit trees. 
Anahit's daughter, Aida, studies at Armenian State Pedagogical University. She is in the 3rd course in the Faculty of Foreign Languages. Anahit's current income does not allow her to save for Aida's education, so she has applied for this loan of AMD 220,000 to pay for her daughter's tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fee for the first semester of University

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Keziah is 35 years old. She is married to Peter and together they have four children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 15 years. She gets a monthly income of KES 15,000 from her business.

This will be her first business loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings to use during this planting season. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to be among the leading farmers in her area and also improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 25 years old and married to Elizabeth. For the past three years he has made a living farming and earns on average 5,500 KES a month.

Peter found out about KADET LTD through his friend who is a registered client. He is applying for a 10,000 KES loan that he will use to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

Peter wants to use his anticipated profits to help his wife start a business. His ambition is to better their living standards.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en: Bahrom is 30 years old and married. He has his own photo salon and works hard to earn a living. He has been in the business for 12 years. Through the financial support from IMON International, he has managed to grow his business. He dreams of expanding his business and becoming prosperous in the future. He needs a loan of $3,000 US to buy a camera. He will look for your help.

loans.use: to buy a camera

loans.name: Alcira Soledad

texts.es:
La Señora. Alcira forma parte del banco comunal El Control, vive  por la comunidad de Punta Corral que pertenece a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, lugar que es conocido como el mirador de la ciudad ya que desde allí se puede admirar una gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, agricultura y comercio.

La Señora Alcira tiene 44 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 26 y 24 años de edad que son casados y viven independientes. Su esposo ha migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo para sacar adelante a toda su familia, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Alcira pasa en  su casa realizando los quehaceres del hogar, para aportar a la economía de su casa se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, cuyes y pollos a los que los vende  en su comunidad, también trabaja en la agricultura cultivando sus terrenos y sus cosechas son para el consumo de su hogar.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y en alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Alcira is part of El Control Communal Bank.  She lives in the community of Punta Corral, in the parish of Turi in Cuenca.  It's known as the viewpoint of the city because a large part of Cuenca can be admired from there.  The people there make a living raising animals, farming, and in commerce.

Alcira, 44, is married and from her marriage has two children, ages 26 and 24, who are married and live on their own.  Her husband migrated in search of a better job to get his whole family ahead.  The house in which she lives is her own.

Alcira works at home doing the housework.  To contribute to the household finances she raises pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens, which she sells in her community.  She also grows food on her plot of land for home consumption.

She's going to use her new loan to buy pigs and animal feed.

Her goal is to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 31-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan, supporting four family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to pay for her home improvements. She wants to repaint her home and to buy new furniture. She hopes to improve her family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to repaint her home and buy new furniture.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 58-year-old married woman who has three family members from Al Hashmi Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 700 Jordanian dinar (JD) to pay for university tuition for her daughter. She hopes for her daughter to continue her education. In the future she wants to buy a new home.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition for her daughter.

loans.name: Nael

texts.en: Nael is a 33-year-old married male from Al Zarqa in Jordan. He has two children and requested a 700 Jordanian dinar (JD) loan to pay for retailing in glassware and clothes to his neighbors. In the future, Nael is planning to expand his project to increase his income and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay for retailing in glassware and clothes.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 41-year-old married man who has five family members from Al Hashmi Amman, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 600 Jordanian dinar (JD) to pay for his home improvements. He wants to do maintenance of the home and to repaint his home. He hopes in the future to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements.

loans.name: Azizbek

texts.en: Azizbek is married and has three children for whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that 10 years ago he began his own business with a barber shop. He has additional income from selling food items. His wife helps him with the business. Their house is in bad condition but Azizbek’s income is not enough to repair it. He is asking for a loan of 4000 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) to buy plastic windows as he plans to change the windows of his house. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy plastic windows.

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.en:
Musharaf is 41 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and three children. She has had her own business for four years, and it is her source of income. She sells women’s clothes. She wants to develop her business but does not have enough money for it. She is asking for a loan to buy a crisper in which she would to sell her goods.

Her goal is to always keep her business brisk, as it is the source of income for her family.

loans.use: To buy a crisper in which she would sell her goods

loans.name: Sura

texts.en: Sura is an 18-year-old single lady. She has five older brothers that look after her. Now Sura has entered the university faculty of science to study chemistry. Sura now wants to start depending on herself so she applied for this education loan to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is an active, entrepreneurial and determined woman. She sells makuti, a thatching material made from palm fronds. She started this business so as to contribute to covering the household’s daily expenses. It has been one of the best and biggest decisions she has ever made.

Mwanasiti sells her makuti from her home to the neighborhood. She has acquired sales experience, which helps her to make a good profit. She has gained a lot of customers because they prefer her excellent service and her product for its quality and affordable price. With this in mind she is now applying for a 40,000 KES loan from Yehu to buy more makuti to sell.

Mwanasiti has many goals she wishes to accomplish. She is confident that she possesses many important skills vital to making this business a success. She is happy in this business and working hard to achieve a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy more makuti to sell.

loans.name: Eline

texts.en: Eline is a 28-year-old housewife. While her husband is serving in the military she started a small business to add another source of income to the family in hopes that it will be a basic one in the future. She brings clothing items from the free zone areas or the wholesale markets and sells them back at her place. Now Eline has applied to this youth loan to bring more collections to sell for the holidays and increase her profits.

loans.use: to bring more collections to sell

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 40-year-old housewife. She is living with her three daughters and son after her oldest got married. The second daughter is a college student now. Fatmeh has applied to this education loan to pay for her registration fees so she can have her chance in getting a university degree.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's registration fees.

loans.name: Khaldoun

texts.en: Khaldoun is a 26-year-old married guy and a father to a baby boy. After graduating as an accountant from the university he started working in a private company. At the same time he opened a shop for selling mobile accessories. Now he applied to this youth loan in order to support his shop and bring more items and goods to sell to increase his profits.

loans.use: to bring more items and goods of phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a thirty-year-old woman, married to Elijah with two children.  She has worked as a door-to-door salesperson for six years in Kiambu, selling new clothes.  She generates a monthly income of fifteen thousand Kenyan Shillings (KES).

This will be Jane's first business loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the whole loan to add to her stock of clothes for resale. 

In the future, Jane wants to be a prosperous businesswoman, and also open a shop where she can sell her clothes.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for resale

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is 57 years old. She describes herself as happy, hard-working and responsible with her children. She lives with her husband and their two children in the town of Msambweni located in the Coast province.

Mwanasiti has a grocery store. Her children help her, because it is the only source of income for covering the household expenses. For this reason, she constantly needs to supply her store with products. This is her third loan with Yehu. The loan will be invested in the purchase of wholesale groceries, like bags of rice, sugar, salt and flour, as well as canned goods, soft drinks, and other things that will allow her customers to have more variety. By doing this, she will be able to obtain good earnings and improve her quality of life.

Mwanasiti dreams that they will continue to support her with loans, so that she can continue to move forward and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale groceries, like bags of rice, sugar, salt and flour, and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as lotions, soap, and umbrellas to sell

loans.name: Martha Johana

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente en Portoviejo  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 15 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 32 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen dos hijos de 11 y 8 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es se dedica a la pesca.

Ella con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella también trabaja base de  pedidos que sus clientes le realizan con anticipación,  les da facilidades de pago pues deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene más de un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  dos ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que representan los créditos para su negocio.

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos
texts.en:
The communal bank “15 de Diciembre” meets every fifteen days in the seaside resort town of San Clemente in Portoviejo.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many national and foreign tourists.  It offers a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of traditional dishes from the region.

Martha lives in this place.  She is 32 years old and lives in a common-law marriage from which she has two children, ages 11 and 8, who attend school.  Her husband makes a living fishing.

With the intention of earning something on her own and with this being able to help her husband with the household expenses, she dedicates herself to business selling all kinds of clothing.  Her method of sales is door-to-door and she also sells in her house where her most well-known clients come.  She also works from a base of orders that her customers make in advance.  She gives them easy payment plans as she puts her customers on credit and collects every fifteen days.  She goes to buy her merchandise in Guayaquil each time she needs it.  She has dedicated more than a year to this activity and it is going very well for her.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothing.  She has been in the communal bank for two loan cycles and she likes the help that the loans represent for her business. 

Her dream is to give her children the very best.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en: Rajaa is a 33-year-old married woman who is looking after four kids. While her kids are at school Rajaa makes spices at home and packs them for sale along with selling different types of nuts. She applied to this loan in order to get more basic ingredients that she makes the spices from, in order to increase her productivity therefore increasing her profits.

loans.use: to get more basic ingredients

loans.name: Shem

texts.en: Shem is a 59-year-old married man with eight children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been a farmer for over ten years. He is mainly challenged by seasonal changes in the area. His personal goal is educating his children while his business goal is hiring employees to help expand business. He intends to use this loan facility to purchase farm inputs such as manure.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as manure.

loans.name: Nama

texts.en: Nama is a 34-year-old married woman who runs a clothing sales business to improve her living conditions. Now Nama has applied to this loan to bring a new collection of winter clothes to prepare for the holiday season.

loans.use: to bring a new collection of winter clothes.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 39 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Christine has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which does tailoring and sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more materials for making clothes both new and second-hand, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and pay for school for her children. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a piece of land and build. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more materials for making clothes both new and second-hand.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a married woman with two children. When asked, she describes herself as a humble woman.

For the past four years Doris has had a shop where she sells cereals. Her shop is located within a busy market ideal for her business, and her primary customers are residents from the surrounding area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of money to put toward improving her business.

Doris is applying for a 20,000 KES loan from SMEP to buy more cereals to sell. Her ambition is to see her business improve substantially within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell.

loans.name: Chelsea Group

texts.en:
This photo shows two members of the "Chelsea" group, which is made up of small-scale businessmen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone.  The Chelsea group has borrowed from SMT/Kiva lenders in the past.  With this loan, they will be able to grow their businesses further, make more profit and further improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Gibo. He is 32 years old, and was born in Kambia town.  He currently lives in Makeni, with his wife and two children. His wife is also a businesswoman, one of his children is attending primary school and the other is not yet of school age. For many years now, Gibo has owned and run a grocery shop. With this loan, he is going to buy items like milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, cheese, etc. to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy items like milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, cheese, etc. to add to his current stock

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married lady, 55 years old, blessed with five children aged between 30 and 22 years. She practices horticulture in her farm and has been in operation for a period of ten years, earning a monthly income of 30,000 KES.  

Leah has borrowed the amount of 60,000 KES from KADET LTD, this being her second loan cycle.  She repaid the previous loan successfully. She wishes to use the new loan to purchase passion fruit seedlings and to prepare the land.

Leah will use her profits to help her children and expand her passion fruit farm. She hopes to live a better life and prosper in her farm.

loans.use: To prepare the land, and to purchase passion fruit seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Helene

texts.en:
Helene is 30 years old, married, and has four children aged between 1 and 7 years.  In addition, she takes care of six relatives. She sells various goods, such as lotions, soaps, and toothpaste, in her store that she operates from 8 a.m until 6 p.m every day (except on Saturdays). Currently, she employs one person to help her. Helene has four years of experience in this business. 

Helene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company, in order to buy various goods to resell, such as those just listed. She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs, to save money for her future, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy various goods, such as lotions, soaps, and toothpaste, to resell.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Ms. Jamila is 58-year-old widow and a mother of five. She is very talented and excels in the work of hand embroidery. She started her work after the death of her husband, 22 years ago. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from the people living around her. In this way she manages to provide for her children. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she needs to purchase more material in bulk such as reels of threads in different colors, packs of needles, sequins, pearls, etc. This compelled her to contact Kashf Foundation and apply for a loan of 15000 Pakistani rupees. In this way she will able to complete the orders on time. Jamila intends to utilize part of the profits on the betterment of her family members and on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase reels of threads in different colors, packs of needles, sequins, pearls etc.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur is 25 years old. He is a single person. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fizuli, now living in the Baku region with his family. Elnur has been engaged in agriculture for the last year.  He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh, good meats are in high demand. People use fresh, good meat every day. Elnur sells cattle meat to the specials shop. Elnur wants to expand his business and produce more as these products are in high demand to cover market demand. Now Elnur needs 2,000 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) to buy to buy calves for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Shakira

texts.en:
Shakira is 31 years old, and married with one child.  She also looks after two relatives. Shakira has run a stall selling pineapples, bananas and other fruit for six years, which she operates every day during the week from 7 a.m until 5 p.m. She currently employs one other person to help her.

Shakira has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more fruits like pineapples and bananas for resale. She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to meet her family's basic needs and to pay for medical insurance.

loans.use: To buy more fruits, like pineapple and bananas, for resale.

loans.name: Anarose

texts.en: Anarose is a hardworking mother who supported her husband in managing their rice farming business. She is now 53 years old and has two grown-up children. They aimed to improve their rice farming business to increase their yields and income to satisfy their necessities and save some for future emergencies. They have been farmers for almost 30 years and usually earn a profits of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in every harvest season. They usually spent their income for their daily consumption and allowances of their children in school. At this time, they are thankful that their two children have already graduated from college and are already employed. Despite this, Anarose and her husband continue managing their farm to earn a living. She is asking for additional capital of 50,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for the maintenance of her rice production. They believe that this loan will help them to improve their farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for the maintenance of her rice production

loans.name: Self Help Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleases to present to you members of the “Self Help” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of 5,800,000.00 Leones (SLL) for the entire group in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Ya Marie is the leader of this group. Ya Marie is 51 years old. She is married with six children who are no longer attending school. Ya Marie sells provisions: milk, sugar, butter, etc. and has been doing business for 30 years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying milk, sugar, butter, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, butter, etc. in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla, age 34, is a responsible and cheerful man. He is well-liked among the people who consume his products. He makes a living selling fish. He gets his merchandise from the fishermen on the shoes of the Indian ocean. For this reason, his business is stable and profitable. Abdalla lives with his family -- his wife and three children.

Abdalla is requesting a loan from Yehu so that he can buy a larger stock of fish. This will help him gain more customers and significantly improve his earnings in the end.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of fish.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda is a 47-year-old mother of six. She has been in a bee-keeping business for the last two years to extract honey and pack it for sale. Now Huda has applied to this loan to expand the business and add more bee cells.

loans.use: to add more bee cells.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Ms. Samina is a 43-year-old woman. She has run a business of tailoring for many years. She started doing it with her mother and then continued it even after her marriage. Her husband is a sole earner of her family and his income is not enough to meet all the expenses of the house alone so Samina is helping her husband by contributing in the family income. She stitches clothes for almost half of the people living in her community.  Life became easier for the family of seven when a second source of income started coming in the house. She has been in association with Kashf for two years. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to purchase another sewing machine so that her daughter can help her after returning from school. According to her it is becoming difficult to fulfill orders on time. She expects a boost in her profits and wishes to spend a part of revenues on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine so her daughter can help her after returning from school.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as a humble woman. She operates a retail store, where she sells cereals. Her business is located within an urban area, and her primary customers are people from the store's environs. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more cereals. 

Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is widowed and has three children who are in school. They live in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Masika currently sells firewood from her home. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to increase her capital to buy more bundles of firewood to sell. Since this is her only source of income for supporting her children, Masika works more than 10 hours a day. This enables her to pay for expenses, such as food and education for her three children.
Masika dreams of having a retail shop in the future and to improve the quality of life for her children. This is the third time she has worked with Yehu, but the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy quarry stone for resale.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 36 years old and is married with five children aged between 10 and 17 years old. She sells various goods such as cakes, bread, sugar, etc, from a store that she operates her work from 6 a.m until 9.30 p.m every day per week. She currently employs four people to help her, and she has eight years of experience in this business.

Francoise has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as cakes, bread, sugar, etc for resale. She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs, to save money for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as cakes, bread, sugar, etc  for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more sugar, rice, potatoes, salt, soap etc. to sell.

loans.name: Prodige Baco Group

texts.en:
Esther, aged 46, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Prodige Baco”, which is composed of 15 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Esther has been in the business world since 1997. She manages her business in the northeastern part of Lubumbashi. She is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC and has already received a loan and has repaid it properly. She intends to use the next loan to increase the inventory of her goods by buying some baskets of fish and boxes of chickens for resale, with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of about US$40. 
Her ambition is to develop it and become financially independent. Esther is married and has five children, who are aged between 4 and 15 years old. Two of them go to school.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her goods by purchasing some baskets of fish and boxes of chickens for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Revendeur d’articles scolaires dans une boutique, Kossi âgé de 30ans est marié une styliste –modéliste. Il n’a pas d’enfants en charge. C’est en 2009 qu’il a commencé son activité et il s’y plait bien car cela lui procure des revendus lui permettant d’assurer les besoins primaires de la famille. En plus de la vente des articles scolaires, il fait de la photocopie aux étudiants et à toutes personnes. C’est justement pour l’achat d’une machine à photocopier qu’il fait un crédit à WAGES. Comme perspectives d’avenir, il veut créer d’autres points pour la photocopie et assurer un avenir meilleur à la famille.
texts.en: A seller of school supplies with a small shop, Kossi, 30, is married to a fashion designer. He is not raising any children. He began his business in 2009 and he feels very good about it because it brings in enough income to cover the basic needs of his family. Besides selling school supplies, he also makes photocopies for students and for whoever else needs them. It is precisely in order to buy a photocopier that he has taken out a loan from WAGES. As far as his plans for the future go, he would like to open up other venues for photocopying and ensure a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tea, bread and beans for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy home products to sell.

loans.name: Petronille

texts.en:
Petronille is 40 years old and married with five children, who are between 6 and 15 years old. Her business is well organized and she sells clothes in the market. 
Petronille has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company to buy more clothes for resale. With the profit from this loan, she will be able to reinvest in her business, pay her children's school fees and save for her future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more juice, Fanta, beer, and other drinks for resale.

loans.name: Namiq

texts.en:
Namiq is a 30-year-old man who is married and has two daughters. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Namiq has six years of experience in this field thanks to his father, who taught him the best ways to look after cattle. He receives 60 AZN financial support from the government monthly, but this is too low to cover family needs.

Namiq usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for five to six months, and then resells them at a profit in the local livestock bazaar. He sells milk and yogurt to his neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings in 150 AZN income per month. Milk and yogurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, and always use yogurt sauce. Milk products are considered very healthy and are also present in everyday life.   

This is his family's only source of income and is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Namiq applied for a 2200 AZN loan to purchase three cattle and two milking cows.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle and two milking cows.

loans.name: Hidayat

texts.en:
Hidayat is 44 years old and an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and three children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. During these years, Hidayat gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose farming because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 
People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan family and are also used to make fresh punch. He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN.
As these products are in high demand, Hidayat wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1450 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 20, is the mother of one child. She lives with her husband, Bakari, and their son in the town of Msambweni.

Fatuma used to be a housewife but a few weeks ago, an idea came to her to start a cosmetics shop. She intends to sell creams, lotions, hair conditioner and beauty products for women and men. She has a small store where she wants to sell from.

Fatuma has requested a 30,000 KES loan. She believes that with financial help she’ll attain what she needs.

loans.use: to buy creams, lotions, hair conditioner and beauty products.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail stall where she sells vegetables and cereals such as potatoes, maize, beans, black beans, and other items. Her business is located within an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy vegetables and grains. Her business goal is to be a successful businesswoman within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and grains.

loans.name: Kougbafo

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes de façon ambulante, Kougbafo âgée de 35ans est mariée à un employé dans une société de la place. Elle  a 03 enfants âgés respectivement de 12,10 et 08ans tous scolarisés. Avec son premier crédit à WAGES, elle va s’approvisionner en pagnes pour revendre à ses clients. Elle voudrait à l’avenir, ouvrir une boutique et aider son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants. Elle est dans  ce domaine il y a 12ans.
texts.en: A street seller of pagnes (colourful West African cloth), Kougbafo is 35 years old and married to an employee of a local company. She has 3 children aged 12, 10 and 8, who all go to school. She will use her first loan from WAGES to stock up on pagnes to resell to her customers. In the future, she would like to open a shop and support her husband with their children's education. She has been in her line of work for 12 years.

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Revendeur de produits d’alimentation générale, Komla est un jeune marié de 27 ans et père d’un seul enfant de 01 an. Il exerce cette activité depuis 2005. Il sollicite son quatrième prêt auprès de WAGES pour élargir et  diversifier son commerce. Il compte réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: A retail grocer, Komla is a young married man, 27 years old, and the father of one child, who is  a year old. Komla has been in this business since 2005. He is requesting his fourth loan from WAGES to expand and diversify his business. He intends to reinvest his profits in his business and ensure his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Revendeuse de tubercules, Adjo  âgée de 58 ans, a débuté cette activité depuis 1974 et dispose d’une place dans un marché. Elle est mariée à un représentant commercial  et ont 05 enfants. Elle sollicite son premier crédit auprès de WAGES pour l’achat des tubercules. Elle recherche à travers les bénéfices de ce prêt, la sécurité alimentaire de sa famille et le développement de son activité.
texts.en:
Adjo, who is 58 years old, has been a reseller of tubers since 1974. She has a stand in a market. 

She is married to a sales representative and they have 5 children. 

She is asking for a first loan with WAGES to buy tubers. With the profits from this loan, she is looking to have enough to eat and to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy tubers.

loans.name: Venant

texts.en:
Venant is 47 years old, married and has seven children between 5 and 19 years old. He is known for selling local drinks. He has two years of experience and he works from 7 a.m until 7 p.m every day except on Sunday. 

Venant has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks to sell. With this loan, he will hopefully earn more profits which. in turn, will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. In addition to that, he will continue improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mena Group

texts.en: In the photo are members of the “Mena” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With their previous Kiva loan, they were able to add more inventory to their respective businesses. This led to a great improvement in their businesses and lives through increased sales and profits. They were able to use the extra profit they made to send their children to school, feed and clothe them. Having repaid that loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan of 3,600,000 Leones for the entire group. With this new loan, they will be able to further expand their business inventories. Fatmata remains the featured leader of this group. Fatmata sells market food and will use her share of the loan to further increase her inventories.

loans.use: to buy firewood, rice, onions, margi, cigarettes, etc. in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 36 years old and married with one child who is 4 years old. He sells bread and tea from a store that he operates from 6:00 a.m until 6 p.m every day. He currently employs one person to help him and he has 3 years of experience in this work.  

Innocent has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via the Vision Finance Company in order to buy more tea and bread to resell. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs and to pay for medical insurance.

loans.use: to purchase more tea and bread to sell.

loans.name: Wayan

texts.en:
Wayan is a Balinese artisan who specializes in batik and beaded baskets and handbags. She would like to invest in the purchase of such raw materials as beads and baskets for production.

Wayan has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is her story:

"After I got married I started to learn beadwork techniques from my mother-in-law. Most people in my husband's village earn their living from beadwork. After six months of learning, I was able to create new designs. My favorite designs are flowers, thunder, balls, mountain, stars and many more."

"At the moment it's difficult to obtain the baskets I need for the beadwork, as they are hand-woven in a village on another island. That is why I'm very happy to receive this microcredit, because it will make it possible to buy larger amounts of baskets and beads in advance. My team will be happy and motivated too. Thank you very much for your support."

Use the link below to view Wayan's beaded, woven and batik accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3458

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of such raw materials as beads and baskets for production

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail store where she sells home products. Her business is located within an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy home products for sale. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy home products for sale

loans.name: Las Rositas De Laderas De Chillon Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! Este es el grupo Las Rositas de Laderas De Chillón
Florencia de 41 años es casada y tiene una hija. Ella tiene su propio negocio un bazar con el nombre de su hija “BAZAR ALEXANDRA” allí vende toda clase de artículos como regalos y ropa, son 12 años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien, sus asiduos clientes son vecinos del lugar y amigos  quienes acuden a comprarle. Ella se esmera en brindarle  buen trato y atención para poder mantener su clientela, por otro lado también para algunas personas,  gracias a sus ingresos  puede ayudar a su familia sobre todo a su hija ya que su mayor sueño es verla convertida en una profesional, el préstamo que ha solicitado lo utilizara para mejorar su negocio con la compra de mercadería para su bazar. Ella está feliz por continuar con su negocio y en un futuro le gustaría ampliarlo.
¡Florencia agradece su apoyo!

*Florencia viste polo negro.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!  This is Las Rositas de Laderas de Chillón Group.

Florencia, 41, is married and has a daughter.  She has her own business, a variety store with her daughter's name, Bazar Alexandra.  She sells all types of things there, such as gifts and clothing.  She has had the business for 12 years and it's going very well for her.  Her devoted customers are neighbors and friends who come to buy from her.  She goes to a lot of trouble to treat and serve them well so she can keep her clientele.  Thanks to her income she can help her family, especially her daughter, because her biggest dream is to see her become a professional.

She will use the loan she has requested to improve her business by buying merchandise for her store.  She's happy about continuing with her business and would like to expand it in the future. 

Florencia is grateful for your help!

*Florencia is wearing a black polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her variety store

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married and has five children. She lives with them and her husband in the town of Msambweni located in the coastal region of Kenya.
She currently gets income from selling fish from her home. In addition, she also sells makuti (palm fronds). She works for over eight hours a day. Her husband and her need to cover the food, education, and medical expenses for their family. 
The loan she is requesting is to buy a frying pan, cooking oil, more fish and makuti.

loans.use: to buy a frying pan, cooking oil, more fish and makuti.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en: Miatta is 33 years old and lives in New Kru Liberia. She is single and stopped her education at 7th grade. For the past six years she has been running a shop where she sells clothes and other items. She started this business with the little money that she received from her boyfriend and learned the ways of selling from her mother. She is very happy with her business because she makes a lot of profit and learns different local languages from her customers. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes, handkerchiefs, socks, head-ties to expand her business. Her plans are to expand her business and build her house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, handkerchiefs, socks, head-ties to expand her business.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet has been running a private medical clinic for the past ten and half years with the monthly income of KES. 20,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Violet will use the loan to buy medical equipment. 

She will plough back the anticipated profit into the business. Her hopes and dreams are to expand the business and improve the family living standard.

loans.use: to buy medical equipment

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 45-year-old married man. He has nine children, with ages ranging from 2 years to 22 years. He describes himself to be a creative and industrious man.  

He operates a retail business where he sells windows, doors, and cooking pots.  He has been involved in this business for 22 years and employs four  staff members. His business is located within a busy town, and his primary customers are local residents . He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient materials for welding. 

He will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a solar lamp to be used by his family members. 

His business goal is to run his own welding company within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Kmzm Progressive Group

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Rambidzai from Mutare, the capital of Minicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is married with three children, two attending school.  Rambidzai runs a business selling clothes. She says the main challenges faced are high custom duties at the South African border. 

Rambidzai has requested a loan of $600 to purchase clothes from South Africa for resale in Zimbabwe. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to complete the family house which is presently under construction. In the future Rambidzai plans to have her own boutique.

loans.use: to purchase clothes in South Africa for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for constructing a dairy unit.

loans.name: Geoginer

texts.en: Geoginer is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as honest. She operates a food stall where she sells vegetables and fruits, such potatoes, cabbages, tomatoes, etc. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an open-air market,  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as a shortage of vegetables and fruits to sell. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell. Her business goal is to run a successful business within five years. She hopes she will improve her business in the future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be a humble woman. She operates a retail store where she sells home products. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located at an urban area, and her primary customers are local residents. 

Mercy describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 10,000 Kes (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy home products for resale. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful in her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy home products for resale.

loans.name: Fransisca

texts.en:
Fransisca is a 27-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail store where she sells home products such as sugar, salt, flour, etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at an urban area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the 20,000 Kes (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy home products. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy retail products.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie, 41, resides with her husband at West Point. She has six children that are between the ages of five and 24. Only two of the children live with her at home, and are in school. The other four children live with other  relatives. 

She has been involved in this business for the past four years; selling (imported) slippers, skirts, and blouses at the market. What she loves most about her business is that she can have more customers, so she make profits every day. With the profits she buy more goods, and help her husband with the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase more (imported) slippers, blouses, and skirts. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Bobby

texts.en: Bobby is 27 years old and single. He is a resident Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past two years, Bobby has owned and operated a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. Each month, he earns 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Bobby been a member of GDMPC since 2010. Bobby is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to purchase vehicle spare parts to maintain his transport business. In the future, he wants to save his revenue for his future family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts to maintain his transport business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is married and the mother of three children. She is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines, where she has run a retail business for six years and earns about 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. She has requested a loan for 5,500 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In 2011, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living conditions. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's life.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
This is Thelma. She previously accessed a 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Thelma hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to have a happy family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard, 34 years old, is a married man. He has seven children, with ages ranging from 3 years to 14 years. He describes himself as a quiet man. He operates a motorcycle providing transportation services. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located within a busy area and his primary customers are local residents from the environs. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the area. He will use this 10,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to run a spare parts retail store within five years. He hopes that in the future he will educate his children to university level. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.
