Jeremy works hard to support her family. Jeremy is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Jeremy requested a 13000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Jeremy has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Jeremy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Leticia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Leticia is borrowing 19000 PHP through NWTF to buy stocks like soap, shampoo, spices, soft drinks, and other items to sell in her general store.

Leticia has sustained her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money so she can afford to send her her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks of soap, shampoo, spices, and soft drinks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Imasumac II”, ella continua dedicándose a la compra y venta de artesanía, ella lleva varios años en este su negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella trabaja todos los días para obtener ingresos económicos y poder así sacar adelante a su familia, ella solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su negocio como por ejemplo chompas y chalinas de lana de alpaca, ella se siente agradecida por el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Vilma continues belonging to the communal bank “Imasumac II” and continues buying and selling handicrafts. She has been in this business for several years and it is going very well, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. Vilma works every day to obtain income to be able to get her family ahead. She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise for her business, such as sweaters and scarves made with alpaca wool. She feels grateful for the loan granted and commits to making her established loan payments.

loans.use: to buy handcrafted merchandise, such as alpaca sweaters.

loans.name: Jaime Ernesto

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 24 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado desde muy temprana edad, lo hacia en compañía de sus dos hermanos mayores y su padre. Él estudiaba y trabajaba al mismo tiempo; cuando su padre falleció sus hermanos ya no se encontraban en su casa. Así que él abandono el estudio y se dedico por completo a trabajar para ayudar a su madre y a su esposa e hijo. 

Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a seis kilómetros de su casa y debe pagar transporte para llevarlos a su casa. El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar una vaca lechera, con esta podrá aumentar la cantidad de leche por que ya tiene dos. Su deseo es comprar más vacas lecheras y aumentar la producción.
texts.en:
Jaime is 24 years old, married and has a son. Since he was very young, he has worked in agriculture and livestock. He did this in company of his older siblings and father. He studied and worked at the same time. When his father died, his siblings were no longer at home. Therefore, he abandoned his studies and dedicated himself fulltime to working in order to help his mother and his wife and son.
He acquires the agricultural inputs in a city six kilometers from his house and has to pay the transport for them to be brought to his house. He is requesting the loan to buy a dairy cow. With this, he will be able to increase the quantity of milk produced (for which he already has two cows). His desire is to purchase more dairy cows and increase production.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 26 years old, single and has 1 child. She is from Tabo-o, Jimenez and been farming for two years, earning an amount of 6,000 PHP each month. 

In 2011, May joined GDMPC. May is requesting a loan of 11,000, which she will use to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next growing season. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next growing season.

loans.name: Lhea

texts.en:
Lhea is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell.

Lhea has been in this business for 12 years. She earns more income from fish vending.

With the help of the loans from NWTF, Lhea has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 49, is married and has three school-age children. She and her husband aim to upgrade their status of living so they can educate their children and give them a better life. 

To generate income, Lydia engages in buying and selling footwear in the public market while her husband manages their farm. She aims to strengthen the business to earn a higher income. She has been in the business for almost three years now. She plans to acquire more stocks of footwear to sell, but she does not have enough capital; therefore, she is requesting a loan of 20,000.00 PHP to buy slippers, sandals, shoes, toys, bracelets and earrings to sell. She believes that through patience and hard work, she will make her business grow more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, sandals, shoes, toys, bracelets and earrings to sell.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: Rufina is a 52-year-old married woman from Dauis, Bohol. She has seven children. The oldest is child is thirty-three while the youngest is nineteen. She sells fish, a business that she has been engaged in for thirty-four years. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase nylon (a high-strength fiber used to make fishing nets and ropes), gasoline for her motorboat, and fish hooks. Rufina would like to augment her business to support her family and to save for the future.

loans.use: to buy nylon, gasoline for her motor boat, and fish hooks.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling fruits in the Philippines.

Marlyn requested a 12000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough to provide a secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell .

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is from Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Helen is married and has 5 children. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale. Helen has been engaged in her business for 20 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Helen joined GDMPC. Now, she is requesting a loan of 4,500 PHP, which she will use to purchase feeding supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 66-year old resident of Macabayao, Jimenez. She provides her 6 children's needs from the little amount of 4,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own piggery business. She has been operating this business for 5 years as a supplement to her husband's income. 

In 2010, she became a member of GDMPC, and now she is applying for a loan of 6,500 PHP from GDMPC microfinance to buy feeding supplies. Marina wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Verna

texts.en: Verna, 42, is married and has 3 children. She is from Sinara Alto, Jimenez. To make a living, Verna grows vegetables to sell; she has been doing this for 2 years. She earns 1,000 PHP a month. Verna is requesting a loan of 1,500 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizers. Verna joined GDMPC in 2008. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Nelsita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nelsita works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling Natasha, MSE and Avon products in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from selling fish. Nelsita is borrowing 14000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional shoes, bags, shirt, and other items to sell.

Nelsita has sustained her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional shoes, bags, shirts, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Sundaymar

texts.en:
Sundaymar is 40 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has three children ages 10 to 22, all of whom attend school. 

For the past 8 years she has been selling rice, oil, vita, etc. in the local market. She started by getting some money from her husband. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, vita, etc. for her business.

She hopes to buy a piece of land and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, vita, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita, separated, is 58 years old and blessed with 5 children. She lives in Macabayao, Jimenez Misamis Occidental. Florita raises bananas to sell to make a living; she has been involved in this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns 2,500 PHP doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more fertilizers and seedlings. Florita been a member GDMPC since 2010. Her dream is to double her business income to improve the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Chirindo

texts.en: Chirindo is a married woman. She has four children ranging in age from 14 years to 28 years. Chirindo describes herself as a social woman. She operates a food stall where she sells ground nuts. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a viable business area, and her primary customers are mostly women and also local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy coconut to sell. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a retail shop and start poultry keeping.

loans.use: to buy coconut

loans.name: Piedad

texts.es: Piedad nació en el centro poblado de Huayocari del distrito de Huayllabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Huayllabamba pertenece a la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco), ella tiene 27 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, tarros de leche, pan, fideos y otras cosas más, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pro Mujer De Huayocari” de la Asociación Arariwa pues es una persona responsable y colaboradora.
texts.en:
Piedad was born in the small town of Huayocari, Huayllabamba district, and she still lives there. This district is a part of the Calca province, department of Cusco. She is 27, married, and has two children, fruits of this beautiful relationship.

She sells essential supplies, such as rice, sugar, milk cans, bread and noodles. She is now requesting a loan to buy rice and sugar by the sack and some additional supplies.

She is a responsible and committed person, and that is why she is a member of the communal bank “Pro Mujer de Huayocari”, part of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar by the sack, and some additional supplies.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, 40, is married and has four school-age children. Due to lack of job opportunities, she engages herself in buying and selling footwear in the Public market to supplement her husband's income. Being responsible parents, they aim to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn a degree and find a good job someday. 

Despite the problems and difficulties she has encountered in life, she has the determination to improve her business. She is asking for a loan of 15,000.00 PHP to buy additional stocks of shoes, slippers, and sandals for sale. She mentioned that this financial assistance will help her to improve the business and hopes that she will become financially stable someday.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of shoes, slippers, and sandals for sale

location.town: Brgy. Don Mariano Perez, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
Nory is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried-fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell for her vending business.

Nory has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from fish vending.

Nory has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 57 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosa has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Rosa has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Rosa has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Rosa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a responsible father who owns and manages a small variety store in his village. He is 30 years old and has two school-age children. He aims to strengthen his sources of living so that they will generate a sufficient income to satisfy his family's needs and finance the education of his children. 

Despite the hardships of living, Ronald believes that he can improve his living conditions. He aims to strengthen his variety store to make it profitable. He is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy snack food, candy, shampoo, beverages, canned goods, noodles, eggs, and seasonings to sell. He hopes that, someday, he will become financially stable and be able to provide his children with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy snack food, candy, shampoo, beverages, canned goods, noodles, eggs, and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Rodelita

texts.en:
Rodelita is 30 years old and single. Her ambition in life is to become successful and financially stable in the future. She has owned and managed a variety store in her community for nearly two years. She typically earns a profit of PHP 10,000 a month, which she uses to support herself and for the education of her younger brother and sister. 

Rodelita aims to strengthen her business and make it a more viable and profitable source of income. She is asking for additional capital of PHP 25,000 to buy school supplies, rice, soft drinks, ink, bread, shampoo, powdered laundry soaps and frozen foods for sale. 

She believes that she will improve the business and make it more profitable as she continues to work hard and strive to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, rice, soft drinks, ink, bread, shampoo, powdered laundry soaps and frozen foods for sale in her store.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 33-year-old married woman from Loboc, Bohol. She is the mother of an 11-year-old son. 

Susana operates a sari-sari (variety) store business. She has been in the sari-sari store business for five years. Aside from her sari-sari store, she raises hogs.

Susana has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy more merchandise such as coffee, canned goods, noodles and additional piglets. She will also use the money to invest in a smart load retail business.

Susana would like to invest in other ventures. This will enable her to save for the education of her son so he will have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as coffee, canned goods, noodles and additional piglets.

loans.name: Al-Wafa Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Wafa. It consists of four ladies. They took out a loan of 270,000 YER.

Ahlam is a single, 24-year-old woman living in Taiz, Yemen. A very hardworking woman, she has worked as a hair stylist in her house for many years. Ahlam can attract clients because she is a professional in her field. She requested a youth loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy cosmetic materials for her business. She will use her profits to reinvest in her businesses and save for her family's needs. She hopes to own a beauty salon

loans.use: to buy cosmetic materials for her business.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 36-year-old man. He is married and has three children. 

He has had a grocery store for five years where he works daily. He started to seek new options to make money. He expanded his business to primarily sell mobile accessories and numbers. He is a successful entrepreneur because he treats his customers well.
  
Now he applied for a loan of 420,000 YER to buy mobile accessories like recharge cards and sim cards for his business.

loans.use: to buy mobile accessories and numbers for his business.

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is a 27-year-old single young man. For the past five years, Tamer has had a store for designing and implementing wedding cards, seals, and shields upon customers' request. This store has been a profitable and the only source of income for him, but also it needs more improvements and support to cover the cost.

Tamer is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new printer machine. Taking this loan will help Tamer to meet the increasing demand from customers by doing his work in high quality and less time. This will increase sales and improve Tamer's income positively.

Tamer is photographed inside his store.

About Shariah-compliant lending:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to buy a printer.

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en:
Erdenetsogt is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children in his wooden house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They built their house themselves.  Since 2007, Erdenetsogt has been working as a driver in a mining company that is undertaking exploration work in another province of Mongolia. His wife has worked as a steel frame worker in a building company for seven years. In winter, when his company stops working due to the frozen ground, Erdenetsogt runs a taxi business and his wife works as a plasterer in her company. His two children attend a secondary school near their home. 

Last spring, Erdenetsogt's coal burning furnace was ruined. So, before the winter, Erdenetsogt is preparing his home and planning to install a low-pressure furnace and build a block fence around his home. For this reason, Erdenetsogt is asking for a 3,000,000 MNT loan. By doing this, his family will be provided with comfortable living conditions. And, most importantly, he can cut their usage of coal by using a low-pressure furnace and save his land from the stiff winds that usually occur in spring.

loans.use: To install a low-pressure furnace and build a block fence around his home

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs Uranchimeg, 52 years old, lives with her husband and two sons in their wooden house, in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Her son Ganzorig is 27 years old; he is a policeman. Younger son Ganbaatar, 24, is a manager in a trading company. Her husband is a pensionary. Uranchimeg has worked as a nurse in the hospital for 32 years. 

Their wooden house is small and old. Mongolia is one of the coldest countries in the world, and borders on Siberia to the north. 

Before the winter comes, Uranchimeg is requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan to build a new, spacious house with less heat loss. She said that her new house will create a warmer atmosphere, and bring happiness to her family every single day.

loans.use: to build a new house

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 22-year-old conservative married woman who cannot appear in the photo due to religious reasons. She asked her husband, who works as a metal-melting technician, to appear in the photo instead of her. 

Abeer has a small business at home selling kitchenware to neighbors and friends to help in improving their living conditions. She has now applied for this youth loan to add more housewares to her collection to increase her revenue.

loans.use: to add more housewares to her business to increase her revenue

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a young mother who runs a small variety store in her village to supplement her husband's income. She is 19 years old and has one infant-age child. She and her husband do not have stable jobs because they got married early without finishing their education. Despite this, they have a strong determination to uplift their status to give their child a better life. 

Mary Joy aims to improve her variety store by increasing her product offerings. However, due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy bread, canned goods, noodles, snack foods, beverages, soaps, candies and soft drinks for sale. She hopes that she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable as she continues to work hard and strive for success.

loans.use: to buy bread, canned goods, noodles, snack food, beverages, soaps, candies and soft drinks for sale in her general store.

loans.name: Mayrambi

texts.ru: Майрамби проживает в районе Яван. Ей 53 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Муж Майрамби фармацевт, у него имеется собственная аптека. Сама Майрамби занимается животноводством. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности Майрамби занимается девять лет. Она берет кредит для закупа мелко – рогатого и крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Mayrambi lives in the Yavan district. She is 53 years old and married. She has four children. Mayrambi's husband is a pharmacist who owns his own pharmacy.  Mayrambi practices animal husbandry. She raises cattle for sale, which she has done for nine years. She is taking out a loan to purchase small livestock and cattle.

loans.use: to purchase goats and bulls

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is a 58-year-old married woman from Daius, Bohol. She has two children ages, 22 and 36. 

She raises hogs. She has been in the hog-raising business for ten years. 

Aside from raising hogs, she is also engaged in a retail business, selling things like bags, clothes, towels and umbrellas.  

She requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy piglets and feed as well as additional merchandise to sell like clothes, bags, and umbrellas. 

Manuela would like to invest in other ventures to support her family and to save for the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds, clothes, bags, umbrella.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Juana, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa en el comercio de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes. Juana en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, y artículos de limpieza e higiene entre otros, para capitalizar su actividad.
Juana está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Las Triumfadoras communal bank in the Andahuaylilas district in the Quispicanchis province of Cusco, Peru.  She continues selling basic needs products in her grocery store.

Juana needs a loan this time in order to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and cleaning and hygiene products, among others.  She needs the loan to capitalize her business activity.

Juana is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to continue in her business activity.  With this work she provides support for her household.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and cleaning and hygiene products.

loans.name: Ochirzaya

texts.en:
Ochirzaya is 23 years old. He lives with his mother in his mother’s old wooden house in the ger district, the area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

He has been running a taxi business since 2008. His mother is a pensioner. 

In July of 2012, he sold his old car and bought a new second-hand one that runs on gas. He loves the car. When he has spare time, he polishes his car. 

A gas car uses less fuel than cars running on other fuel. On the other hand, gas cars are highly susceptible to cold and break down easily. So before the winter, Ochirzaya is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to build a garage for his car in order to prolong the life of his car as long as possible.

loans.use: to build a garage for his car.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien was born in 1980. She has a child who is learning at primary school. Her husband and she sell beverages to earn a living. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,500,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy tea leaves and coffee beans to make beverages in her beverage stall. She always wants to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves and coffee beans to make beverages in her beverage stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Abadahemana Group

texts.fr:
Séraphine  fait partie du groupe Abadahemana   et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 43 ans et est mariée à  Joseph,  un  cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants, le cadet a 6ans et l’aîné 18ans, c’est ce dernier qui étudie.

Elle  fait le commerce de beignets  depuis  8 ans. 

Elle est à son quinzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter  la quantité de beignets à vendre, pour gagner plus. 

Grâce  aux bénéfices de son commerce, elle nourrit ses enfants, les  habille,les fait soigner et  paie les frais scolaires de son enfant.
texts.en:
Séraphine is part of the Abadahemana group and lives in Gitega. She is 43 years old and married to Joseph, a farmer. Together they have two children, the younger one is 6 years old, the older one 18. The older one goes to school.

Séraphine has been selling beignets (a type of donut) for 8 years.

She is on her fifteenth loan with Turame. With the loan she is requesting, she will increase the quantity of beignets to sell in order to earn more.

Thanks to the income from her business, she feeds her children, clothes them, takes care of them and pays the school fees of the older one.

loans.use: she will increase the quantity of beignets to sell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Dina  Doris

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Dina, ella pertenece al banco “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de 
Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de productos diversos en una tienda bazar la cual pudo acondicionar con mucho esfuerzo en su domicilio. Dina en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como cuadernos, útiles de escritorio, productos de belleza y pequeños regalos. Dina está satisfecha con el fruto de su trabajo y sacrificio, y por ello agradece a KIVA que le ayuda siempre en el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the Las Triumfadoras communal bank in the Andahuaylilas district in the Quispicanchis province of Cusco, Perú.  She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman.  She continues selling diverse products at a general store, which she was able to, with great effort, arrange at her home.

Dina is now requesting a loan to buy merchandise like notebooks, stationery supplies, beauty products, and small gifts.  Dina is happy with the fruit of her work and sacrifice.  Therefore, she is grateful to Kiva because it always helps her in the growth and strengthening of her business activity.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies, beauty products, and small gifts for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to paint the front of her home.

loans.name: August

texts.en:
August is 32 years old and is married with one child. He owns a business selling various goods such as lotions, soap, rice, salt, cooking oil etc. He has three years of experience and he works at his business from 6 a.m until 9 p.m every day. August currently employs one person to help him. 

He has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as sugar, rice, salt, cooking oil, and body lotion for resale. Through this expansion, August will be able to earn more profit which will be used to expand his general store and save for his future.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as sugar, rice, salt, cooking oil, and body lotion for resale.

loans.name: Niazmeen

texts.en:
Niazmeen is a 56-year-old married woman. She is a famous tailor who stitches clothes for more than half of the community she lives in. She has been in the business of stitching for many years. Currently, Niazmeen is a successful tailor with two stitching machines and her daughter as an assistant who helps her so she can fulfill orders in less time. 

She is a mother of five children and motivated to provide them with good quality food and education. She has borrowed PKR 20,000 so she can purchase different colors of reels of threads and packs of buttons, laces and zips. In this way, she can complete orders on time.  

Niazmeen says, “This is what I have done. Nothing remarkable, but I have fulfilled my responsibility towards my children who will now go to school and gain knowledge that I was never able to acquire.” 

She is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: To purchase different colors of reels of threads and packs of buttons, laces and zips.

loans.name: Dong

texts.en:
Dong was born in 1962. She has two children who are carpenters. 

Her husband and she sell vegetables to earn a living. They have done this work for 20 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2006. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow vegetables. She always wants to open a fresh vegetables store.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a responsible mother aiming to become financially stable to satisfy their family's needs and give them a better life. 

Likewise, Flordeliza aims to improve her small business to generate sufficient income to support her family's needs. 

She is now 44 years old and has four school-age children. Due to the high cost of school fees and transportation, they need to increase their income to continue sending their children to school. 

She wants to acquire more footwear to sell but she has inadequate capital. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional stocks of sandals, slippers and shoes to sell. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business and hopes that someday she will make it more viable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of sandals, slippers and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Ms Sughran is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. For eight years, Sughran has been selling milk, a business she initiated by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only income-earner. With the passage of time her sales have increased, as has her income. She now has three buffaloes thanks to her courage and determination.

Because of her work, Sughran is respected in her home, helping her husband in all family and financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. In association with Kashf foundation for three years, Sughran has acquired some savings and is now applying for a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Sughran is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a married mother of four, describes herself as a humble woman. For five years she has been operating a pharmacy located in an urban area; her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.

Grace will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy medicine to sell. Her business goal is to run a profitable pharmacy within five years while making improvements in its operation. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ruth Filomena

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Ruth, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa con su actividad económica en la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, pollos y cuyes, los cuales comercializa en los mercados de Quincemil provincia del Cusco. Ruth en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar pollos y gallinas para su comercialización.
Ruth está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar con su actividad económica y con este trabajo llevar el sustento a su hogar y ayudarla a terminar de construir su casa, que es el objetivo principal de la socia.
texts.en: The borrower is Ruth. She belongs to the communal bank “Las Triunfadoras” of the district of Andahuaylillas, province of Quispicanchis in Cusco – Perú. She continues with her business of raising small animals such as domestic fowl which she then sells at the Quincemil markets in the province of Cusco. Ruth is asking for a loan to buy hens and chickens for resale. She is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to continue with her business, and with this work to support her household and help her to finish building her house, which is her primary goal.

loans.use: to buy hens and chickens.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 51-year-old married woman who has been running a business of milk selling with her husband for many years. 

She has two buffalo in milk and sells their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family.

She is a mother of four children. She needs to earn more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to increase sales, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy one more buffalo to serve more customers. She hopes to increase production capacity, which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She desires to spend part of profits on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: To buy one more buffalo to carter more customers.

loans.name: Mwonthea

texts.en:
Mwonthea is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as an honest woman. 

She operates a food stall where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located at a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy cereals to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cereals to resell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 21 years old and still single. Due financial difficulties, she did not pursue her studies in college. Despite this, she decided to engage in business to earn and save more income to continue her studies later. She runs a small variety store in her community selling different grocery items. 

She aims to improve and strengthen her business to make it more profitable. However, due to insufficient capital, she requires a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy rice, canned goods, bread, beverages, noodles, eggs, soaps and seasonings for sale. Through this loan, she believes that she can improve her business, and she hopes that someday she will become financially stable enough to continue her studies in college.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods, bread, beverages, noodles, eggs, soap and seasonings for sale.

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle is a 35-year-old from Panglao, Bohol. She is a single mom of a three-year-old daughter.She is engaged in selling firewood. Aside from her firewood-selling business, she also sells ice candy. She has been in the firewood business for three years.

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more firewood, ice candy wrappers, and fruit-flavored juices like mango, buko (coconut) and avocado. In the future, Rochelle would like invest in other ventures so that she can support her child's needs.

loans.use: to buy firewood, ice candy wrappers, and fruit-flavored juices.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Ms Naheed, a 36-year-old married mother of four, faced a difficult time after her husband‘s failure in business. She then decided to work with her husband and to support her family for a better future. Seven years ago Naheed started stitching for the people around her home and has since become very well-known for her work. However, due to a lack of financial resources she was unable to meet customer demand and so contacted Kashf foundation at the suggestion of her friend.

Now in association with Kashf for six years, Naheed has requested a loan of Rs. 30000. This amount will help her to buy a bundle of cloth, more reels of threads, and packs of buttons, laces and zips in various colors in order to increase her revenues and income. She desires to provide a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of cloth, more reels of threads, and packs of buttons, laces and zips in various colors.

loans.name: Joyeuse-M Group

texts.fr: La cliente Luanda est vice présidente du groupe d’affaire Joyeuse Mpya, entrepreneur très ambitieux expérimentée. Agée de 45 ans. Elle est une femme non mariée, sans conjoint et Mère de 3 enfants. La cliente est vendeuse de pagnes. Elle étale ses marchandises au marché central de Virunga. Elle commença son entreprise avec son fonds propre reçu de son grand frère. Plus tard, elle sollicita le soutien de l’IMF Hekima. Elle vient de réaliser 3 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit de Hekima. Environs 10 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec plus au moins 18 pièces de pagnes. Cette cliente est confortable avec son business. Dans le futur, elle compte acheter une parcelle et construire une maison d'habitation. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes.
texts.en:
The client, Luanda, is vice-president of the Joyeuse Mpya business group and a very ambitious and experienced entrepreneur. She is 45 years old. She is not married, and she has three children.

Luanda sells pagnes. She sells her goods at the central Virunga market. She started her business with her own funds that she received from her older brother. Later, she sought support from the microfinance institution, Hekima. She has just gone through her third cycle in Hekima's micro-lending program. She has been running her business for about ten years now.

This new loan will allow her to stock up with 18 pagnes. Luanda is comfortable with her business. In the future, she plans to buy a parcel of land and build a house. She would like to thank Hekima for supporting and empowering women who are small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 18 pagnes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Luzveña

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Luzveña, ella pertenece al banco “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de 
Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una joven muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella continua dedicándose a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas y los comercializa en los mercados del Cusco. Luzveña se dedica a esta actividad hace algún tiempo porque con los ingresos que puede ganar, ella está ahorrando para poder estudiar. La socia en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar más animales de corral como cuyes y gallinas. Luzveña está satisfecha con el fruto de su trabajo y sacrificio, y por ello agradece a KIVA que le ayuda siempre en el fortalecimiento de su actividad económica y con sus proyectos académicos.
texts.en: The borrower is Luzveña, and she belongs to the communal bank "Las Triunfadoras" in the Andahuaylillas district in the province of Quispicanchis Cusco-Perú.  She is a hard-working and enterprising young woman, and continues to make a living growing and selling small animals, like guinea pigs and chickens.  She sells them at the markets in Cusco.  Luzveña has been making a living in this business for some time.  With the income that she can generate, she is saving so that she can study.  For this opportunity, she is asking for a loan to buy more barnyard animals, like guinea pigs and chickens.  Luzveña is satisfied with the fruit of her work and sacrifice and she is therefore thankful to KIVA for always helping her in strengthening her economic activity and with her academic projects.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be humble woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. 

Esther's business is located at an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy cereals. Her business goal is to be a successful businesswoman  within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Ms. Zahida is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has been in the business of stitching for the last six years. She started from the stitching of dresses but, with the time, she expanded her business and bought other machines to involve more women in assisting her in her small training center for stitching. Zahida’s husband is a railway employee. His earnings are insufficient to meet the needs of the family members alone. She believes in giving proper formal education to her children and that’s why all of her children are going to school. Zahida is happy to see her children studying, unlike other children of her community. 

Zahida has been in association with Kashf foundation for six years. She has an excellent repayment behavior. She needs to purchase two more sewing machines and reels of threads, buttons and zips, so she has requested for a loan of PKR 45,000. She desires to become a successful entrepreneur and has future plans to form a stitching unit. Her husband admires her efforts and wishes her good luck for the future because, without her assistance, he would never come up with the whole responsibility of providing health, education and other facilities to his family.

loans.use: to purchase two more sewing machines and reels of threads, buttons and zips.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a hard working mother who is engaged in buying and selling of scrap materials in her community. Her activities help her husband in generating income. She is 46 years old and has five grown-up children. Two of her children are still studying in tertiary education. Ruby and her husband want their children to earn a degree and become professionals someday. 

Due to financial difficulty, this couple needs to earn a higher income to satisfy their necessities and to continue financing the education of their children. For this reason, Ruby aims to strengthen her business to earn a higher income. She is asking for an additional capital of PHP 20,000.00 to buy used bottles, steel, used papers, plastics and other scrap materials to sell. She hopes that this financial support will enable her to improve the business and hopes that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy used bottles, steel, used papers, plastics and other scrap materials to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Don Mariano Marcos, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail store where she sells shoes and clothes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located at an ideal business location and her primary customers are local residents. 

Purity describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy shoes and clothes to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is a forty year old married woman from Loboc, Bohol. She has six children. She raises hogs. Aside from hog raising business, she is also engaged in fish vending.

Nelfa has been in the hog raising business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional piglets, feed, and pig supplements. Nelfa would like to invest in other ventures to support her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feeds, pig supplements.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 22 years to 27 years. She describes herself to be quiet woman. 

Annah operates a livestock business where she sells goats, chickens, etc. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located at an agricultural area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high transportation cost for delivering livestock to customers. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy goats to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to educate her children with the profits made from the business. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest woman. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located at an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Martha's biggest business challenge is inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy cereals to sell. Her business goal is to run a profitable business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Rafiqa

texts.en:
Ms. Rafiqa is 43 years old and a vigorous, married woman. She has been in the work of hand-embroidery for the past 15 years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. She offers special designs for the occasion of weddings. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is a labor person, and he does not earn enough to support his family well. With the passage of time, Rafiqa's embroidery patterns became popular on her street and in a nearby market, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She is a mother of four children and is responsible for providing them with good quality food, heath and education. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 20,000 Rs. (Pakistan rupees) to buy raw materials such as fabric, threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. 

She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her community. She would like to teach them embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business, and also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as fabric, threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be a humble woman. She operates a general store, where she sells shoes and home products. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located at an urban area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. 

She will use the 20,000 Kes (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy shoes and home products for selling. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy shoes and home products to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 53 years old. He lives in Tskaltubo District with his 3 grown sons and a daughter-in-law. David requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is a small agricultural business. They have 2 milk cows and 2 calves. They produce cheese and sell locally. In addition, David owns 0.5 hectare of land where he plants different kinds of vegetables. Besides his agricultural activities, David works as a baker and gets a small monthly income. It is hardly enough food for a five member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

David requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business and build a greenhouse. His loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages a provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, David will purchase all the building materials for the greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built properly, David will grow greens and the harvested products will be sold for a good price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family income and all members will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and sow greens

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” HATUNCHASKAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia continua con su negocio de venta de artesanía ella se dedica a la compra y venta de chompas, polos, cerámicas entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia su negocio,la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria repartiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan como tiendas de turismo,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderia como chompas de alpaca.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This is one of the members of Hatunchaskas, a Communal Bank located in the Cusco district, province and department.

She keeps on running her activity, selling crafts. She buys and sells jumpers, polo shirts and ceramics among other products. She has been engaged in her activity for a few years and things are going well thanks to the dedication she daily works with. She is a street vendor, and she sells her products upon request to her customers, such as tourist stores. She is a responsible and persevering person, as though this activity she provides for her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy products such as alpaca jumpers.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayments of her dues.

loans.use: To buy products such as alpaca jumpers.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 2 años de edad. Su esposo es maestro en aluminio y vidrio. 

Ella estudia en un instituto de la ciudad y tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, además de estos productos también vende productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) los mismo que vende en su local y en ciertos días sale a recorrer por la localidad. Lleva cuatro años con su tienda y empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos, además de perfumes y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos. 

Su meta es algún día tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The “Los Tres Ángeles” (The Three Angels) communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renown both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

María lives in this place.  She’s 22-years-old, married and has a two-year-old son.  Her husband is a master in aluminum and glass.  She’s attending an institute in the city and also sells groceries at home.  She sells all types of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, etc.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  In addition to these products she also sells Avon products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories) both in her store and also from place to place in her community.  She’s had the store for four years and started it with the first loan she got from the institution.

She will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, canned goods as well as perfumes and other basic staples.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and likes it because of the help she always gets from the loans.  Her goal is to have a house of her own someday because she’s currently a renter.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: La socia Maria sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Imasumac II”, ella sigue dedicándose a la venta de joyas como por ejemplo aretes, pulseras, anillos y entre otros, ella y su esposo elaboran juntos diferentes tipos de joyas, ellos llevan varios años en este negocio y les va muy bien por lo tanto desean comprar más mercadería, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo para la elaboración de aretes como por ejemplo alambre, ella agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: Maria continues to be a part for the Communal Bank “Imasumac II.”  She is still in jewelry sales, such as earrings, bracelets, rings, and others.  SHe and her husband work together making different types of jewelry, and they have been in this business for several years and it's going very well for them, so they want to buy more merchandise.  She is currently seeking this loan as an opportunity to buy working materials for making earrings, such as wire.  She is thankful for the support that has been offered and she promises that she will repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy materials for making earrings, for example, wire.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 33 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children. She lives in the municipality of Mombasa in the Coast Province.
Agnes makes a living selling clothes in a small store. She is going to invest the loan proceeds in the purchase of more clothing for sale.
She purchases her supplies in the city. Agnes' dream is to have enough money to open a boutique. She has encountered challenges, such as high costs and competition.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell in a small store.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is a woman with a desire to offer better conditions for her family so that they don't suffer from an increase in social violence and poverty that currently oppresses many in the place where they live. This is her main reason for deciding to install a store where she sells basic goods to her neighbors and passersby. She has an abundance of customers, offering accessible prices and a variety of items, but there are products that she doesn't have. Nelly feels the desire and need to increase her source of income, which is why she came to Yehu to ask for a loan to buy her most in-demand products: flour, detergents, sugar, rice and beans. She doesn't have the necessary capital to keep investing in her business. She is sure that she will be able to pay off the loan and gives thanks in advance to all of the good-hearted people who will help her.

loans.use: to buy her most in-demand products: flour, detergents, sugar, rice and beans.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1966. She has two children. One child is a student, one child is a soldier. Her husband is a retired soldier. His pension is about 6,000,000 VND. Thuy sells clothes to earn a living. She gains from it 3,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In this first loan cycle, Thuy would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy clothes to sell in her store. She always wants to raise her children growing well and can get a job in the future. She also wants to save enough money for her retirement.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in her store.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 25 years old. She is married and has 2 young children. Her business is selling basic products such as groceries, rice, sugar, etc.. Her store is located in her home. 

In addition to this business, Janet sells dry fish which is doing well. She is going to use this loan to buy sacks of dry fish, and in this way increase her working capital. This is her fourth loan with this institution. Her reason for applying for this loan is to continue expanding her business, since with the last loan it went very well. She is going to use the earnings to continue buying merchandise and thus improving her income. Her wish for her retail shop business is to have a wide range of basic products to offer her customers and increase her sales and therefore her earnings.

loans.use: to buy sacks of dry fish

loans.name: Phiona's Group

texts.en:
Phiona 's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Phiona is 19 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Phiona has been working hard to manage her salon, which sells hair products. 

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hair products for the salon, and will help Phiona to generate greater profits to sustain her family. Phiona hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Phiona  is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more hair products for her salon.

loans.name: Sol Radiante-Wimpillay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL RADIANTE - WIMPILLAY”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es  el señor  Darío, el socio es conviviente tiene 31 años de edad y tiene 1 hijo; él socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de taxi, el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 07:00am hasta las 07:00pm aproximadamente, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su carro como en el cambio de aceite.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la decoración, brindando servicio de taxi, restaurante, depósito, docentes.

Las personas que salen en la foto adjunta son socias que pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “SOL RADIANTE-WIMPILLAY” (Bright Sunshine). This (communal) bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Dario who lives with his common-law partner. He is 31 years old and has one son. He alternates his daily activities providing taxi service, he has been working in this business for years which he does well thanks to the effort he puts in every day in his work. He works Monday to Friday from about 7am to 7pm. He is a responsible and hardworking person therefore can help his family get ahead.

Dario is requesting a loan for the maintenance of his car such as oil changes. The other members work in design, providing taxi service, restaurants, stores and teaching.

The people in the small photo are members who asked to be late to the meeting because of work obligations. 

He thanks those who are a part of this dream by this means and he promises to honour the payments on the established due dates.

loans.use: to help with the maintenance of his car such as oil changes.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe tiene 31 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre pero todavía no tiene hijos, ella vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza sus diferentes actividades económicas, ella tiene una actividad económica principal que consiste en la elaboración de artesanía, ella pinta cuadros de diferentes paisajes de la ciudad del Cusco, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo pinceles, pinturas y otras cosas más.
texts.en: Guadalupe is 31 years old and lives in a common law marriage but does not yet have any children.  She lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, where she engages in different types of work.  She has a primary line of work which consists of the creation of art.  She paints pictures of different landscapes in the city of Cusco.  At this moment, she is in need of a loan to buy materials for her work, such as brushes, paints, and other items.

loans.use: to buy materials for her work, for example brushes, paints, and other items.

loans.name: Richard Augusto

texts.es: Richard pertenece al banco comunal “Imasumac II”, él nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde repara autos, él requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo pistones, lubricantes y otras cosas más, él agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: Richard is a member of the community bank “Imasumac II.”  He was born in the city of Cusco and lives in that same city where he was born.  He has a small shop in his home where he repairs cars.  He needs a loan to buy materials for his work, like pistons, lubricants, and other things.  He appreciates the support that he has been given and he also promises to repay his loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: ﻿to buy materials for his business, like pistons, lubricants, and other things.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms. Razia is 31 years old and married. She has five children, two daughters and three sons. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and healthcare. Her husband is employed in a small weaving factory. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business to contribute to the family income.

Razia has been in the business of sewing and embroidery for many years. She is well familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

She requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to replace her old sewing machine and purchase a stock of thread of different colors, buttons, needles, etc. Then she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She expects a boost in her net income and wishes to spend the part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and a stock of thread of different colors, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en:
Moureen's program is comprised of  hard-working women. Moureen is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Moureen has been working hard to manage the store where she sells shoes. 

To help expand her business, Moureen has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes for the store, and it will help Moureen to generate greater profits so she can pay school fees. Moureen hopes that she will be able to be a successful entrepreneur in the future 

Moureen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is 26 years old. He is single and lives in Tskaltubo district of West Georgia. Mikheil requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for the business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and his poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for Mikheil is his small monthly income working as a local artisan. In addition, he runs a small-scale agricultural business and has a plot of land and a vineyard. Mikheil grows nuts and picks grapes in the late summer to produce wine. The harvested nuts and wine are sold at the local open market. It makes totally 200 Laris per month, which is hardly enough for food and everyday expenses. According to Credo estimations, Mikheil belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Mikheil requested a loan from Credo to start-up a dairy business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages a provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Mikheil will purchase a milk cow. After the milk cow is purchased, he will be able to receive milk and produce dairy products, which will be sold at the local open market. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase his monthly income and Mikheil will improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut was born in 1953. She has four children who have got married.  Her husband is a retired teacher.  His pension is about 3,000,000 Dong (VND).  Ut sells plastic household appliances, candies and biscuits to earn a living.  She gains from it 3,000,000 VND a month.  Her family's total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month.  

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. For the last loan she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid it on time.  For this loan, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy plastic household appliances, candies and biscuits for her store.  She always wants to save enough money for her retirement.

loans.use: to buy plastic household appliances, candies and biscuits for her store.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 35-year-old married man.  He has 3 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 12 years.  He describes himself to be a humble and soft-spoken man.  

He operates a retail store where he sells phone accessories.  He has been involved in this business for 12 years.  His business is located at an ideal  location and his primary customers are local residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.  

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy phone accessories to sell.  His business goal is to run a retail store selling mobile phones within 5 years.  He hopes that in the future, he will expand his retail store.  This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy phone accesories

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1969. She has two children who are workers.  Her husband collects metal scraps to earn a living.  His income is about 3,000,000 Dong (VND).  Thuy has a grocery store.  She gains from it 3,000,000 VND a month.  Her family's total earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month.  

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last loan cycle she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid on time.  For this loan, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy rice, canned food, candies and biscuits for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned food, candies and biscuits for her grocery store.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.es: Bibiana se sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Imasumac II” y sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras y frutas (manzanas, naranjas, plátanos, uvas, zanahorias, tomates, lechugas y zapallos), ella sale a vender a partir de las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m. ella solicita el crédito para comprar zanahorias, tomates, zapallos, manzanas, naranjas, uvas y plátanos, ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Bibiana continues to be a member of the community bank “Imasumac II” and continues to be in the sales of fruits and vegetables (apples, oranges, plantians, grapes, carrots, tomatoes, lettuce, and pumpkins).  She goes out to make her sales from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She is asking for this loan to buy carrots, tomatoes, pumpkins, apples, oranges, grapes, and plantains.  She is very happy about the loan and promises to make her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy carrots, tomatoes, pumpkins, apples, oranges, grapes, and plantains.

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Chuluunbaatar is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He owns a plot of land and a house on it. His elder daughter works as a salesperson and the younger one is studying Law at the University. His wife, Uranchimeg, works as a cleaner in a sock-making textile factory. He has been operating a taxi business using his own car. 

Chuluunbaatar's elder daughter had been working for a retail shop as a salesperson for a few years, and gathered quite a good knowledge about retail business. So she decided to run a clothes-selling retail business on her own, and she needed some start-up capital. For this reason he took out his first loan. His daughter's business is successful. Now he is requesting a loan to purchase construction material. He is planning to reconstruct the second floor of their house.

loans.use: to purchase construction material to reconstruct the second floor of his house

loans.name: Sabanisso

texts.en:
Sabanisso is from Tajikistan.  It’s a country where one can disconnect from noise and appreciate the beauty of nature, since its scenery is very beautiful. Sabanisso loves her country very much.
She is 65 years old. Sabanisso is married and has two children. To make a living, she sells food in a shop. She has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns little money from her activities.
She is requesting a loan of 2000 somoni, which will be used to buy more food items and increase the variety of food that she offers.
She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy food to offer greater variety in her shop.

loans.name: Mwende

texts.en:
Mwende, 37, is a married mother; she has three children and lives in the municipality of Mombasa.  She's always been a merchant; she has been selling phone accessories, a business she has been into for the last five years.  She sells these products from a small store where she rents.  

She's been a Yehu client for one loan counting this second one for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she will use to buy more phone accessories.  Her goal is to increase her clientele.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 48-year-old married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a retail store where he sells cereals such as maize, beans etc. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located at an ideal business site and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

John will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy ten bags to sell. His business goal is to restock his store  within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will manage to be a  wholesale distributor of cereals to his customers and to retailers. This is the third loan he is taking with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of maize

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан 46 лет, родилась и выросла в Селе Арал. У Бурулкан 3 детей, старшая дочка замужем а младшая дочка и  мальчик учаться вшколе.Муж Бурулкан скоропостижно скончался.Бурулкан по профессии преподаватель начальных классов, она работает в местной школе  но не смотря на это в течении многих лет основным источником дохода для семьи Бурулкан является животноводство. Они начали свой бизнес с 50,000 сом. Ежемесячный доход Бурулкан составляет 5,000 сом.В у Бурулкан есть 1 корова, 1 лошадь и 7 голов баранов. Бурулкан Обратилась в «Бай Тушум и партнеры» в третий раз, все кредиты она использовала для расширения и развитие бизнеса. В этот раз она запросила 130,000 сом. На полученные деньги она хочет закупить 2 молодые коровы и 12 голов овец . По своему характеру Бурулкан очень спокойная и ответственная женщина. Результаты и состояние хозяйства заемщицы говорит о её трудолюбии. В планах у Бурулкан собрать деньги и купить квартиру для дочери в Бишкеке. Цель её жизни воспитать детей, и дать им хорошее образование.
texts.en: Burulkan is 46 years old. She was born and grew up in the village of Aral. Burulkan has three children: her elder daughter is married, and the younger daughter and son are still in school. Burulkan’s husband died prematurely. Burulkan is a grammar school teacher by education and works at the local school. Nevertheless, raising livestock has been the main source of family income for many years. Their business was launched with 50,000  KGS. Burulkan’s monthly income is 5,000 KGS. Burulkan’s farm includes one cow, one horse, and seven sheep. Burulkan has turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for the third time; she used her prior loans for expanding and developing her business. This time she is requesting 130,000 KGS. She would like to use this loan to buy two young cows and 12 sheep. Burulkan is a very calm and conscientious person.   The results obtained by Burulkan and the condition of her farm witness to her hard work. Burulkan’s future plans include saving enough money to buy an apartment in Bishkek for her daughter. Her life goal is to bring up her children and provide them with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase 2 cows and 12 sheep.

loans.name: Yenny
