texts.es: Yenny continúa en el banco comunal “Imasumac II” y en el negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos. Su sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, tarros de leche y galletas al por mayor. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yenny continues to be a member of the community bank “Imasumac II” and is in the business of selling everyday necessities.  She has a grocery store in her home.  For the past several years she has been in this business and it is going very well for her.  Because of this business, she is able to support her children.  Her dream is to expand and improve her business.  She is asking for this loan to buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, jugs of milk, and cookies at wholesale prices.  She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, jugs of milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Ruth Magaly

texts.es: Ruth Magaly continúa en el banco comunal “Imasumac II” y con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza, además con la compra y venta de ropa. Su mercadería de ropa distribuye a diferentes revendedores y clientes. Ella es una persona alegre y responsable que saca adelante a su familia. Solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa como: casacas y chompas. Ella se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Ruth Magaly continues as a member of the community bank Imasumac II and with her business selling beauty products as well as buying and selling clothing.  Her clothing business distributes to different resellers and customers.  She is a happy and responsible person who tries to improve the life of her family.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase clothing such as jackets and sweaters.  She is grateful for the loan provided and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as jackets and sweaters.

loans.name: Yedi

texts.es: Yedi continua con la actividad de brindar servicio de taxi. Su jornada laboral empieza desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 10:00 p.m.  de lunes a sábados. Por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su familia. Su sueño es mejorar en su negocio de servicio de taxi. Solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yedi continues with his business of offering taxi service. His daily work begins at 6:00 a.m. and goes to 10:00 p.m. from Monday to Saturday. With this business he is raising his family. His dream is to improve his taxi service business. He is applying for the loan to buy tires for his car. He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es: Yeny continúa con el banco comunal “Imasumac II” y con su negocio de venta de CDs y ahora tambien DVDs, ella vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco desde las 08:00 a.m. hasta las 05:00 p.m. de lunes a viernes sus productos. Ella es una persona carismática y responsable que saca adelante a su familia. Solicita el crédito para comprar de más CDs y DVDs. Esta agradecida por el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Yeny continues to be a member of the communal bank "Imasumac II" and with her business of selling CDs and now also DVDs. She sells her products in one of the markets in the city of Cusco from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. from Monday to Friday. She is a charismatic and responsible person who is raising her family. She is applying for the loan to buy more CDs and DVDs. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to buy more CDs and DVDs to sell

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es: Aristides continua en el banco comunal “Imasumac II” y con el negocio de elaboracion, compra y venta de artesanía. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Cuando no le alcanza tiempo de elaborar artesania el tiene que comprar artesania de sus colegas y asi no dejar de distribuir mercaderia. Muchas personas le solicitan sus productos como chompas de alpaca y cerámicas pues son hechos con una buena calidad. Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como cerámicas. Se siente agradecido por el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Aristides continues as a member of the Imasumac II community bank.  He also continues his business making, purchasing, and selling handicrafts.  He has had this business for many years and it is going well.  When he does not have time to make handicrafts himself, he has to purchase them from his colleagues so that he does not stop distributing merchandise.  Many people request his products such as alpaca sweaters and ceramics since they are of very good quality.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise such as ceramics.  He is grateful for the loan provided and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as ceramics.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 22 year old Lebanese single woman living with her mother and two siblings. Her mother is the one covering the family expenses after living in unpleasant financial conditions. Her youngest sibling is also seeking to supplement their income and therefore enhance their way of living. This was the same reason of why Aida started to work as a beautician. She works from home and also visits customers wherever they are located. In parallel, she has been working as a sales woman at one of the local clothing shops. Today, she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase beauty products and cosmetics so that she can improve her business operations and follow up on the new fashion. Aida looks forward to open her own beauty salon, better support her family and definitely get married and have her own family with children.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and cosmetics

loans.name: Marale

texts.en: This is Marale, a 49 year old divorcee who lives in Lebanon. With an adorable family of two working children, she has decided to carry on with her life despite all the circumstances. Marale receives a fair amount of money from her husband each month. At this time, she’s cooperating with her children to improve their standard of living. Marale decided to take advantage of the great location of her house to start her own business as a tailor twelve years ago. She works with a high degree of professionalism and has her own loyal customers. As she wants to develop her business and improve her work, she decided to take out a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a modern tailoring machine, which can speed up her work and make it much easier. This Kiva loan will allow her to increase her income by at least 20%. This is how Marale works every day to turn her greatest dream into a reality and have a bigger business.

loans.use: to purchase a modern tailoring machine.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam was born in 1958. She has three children who are at college. Her husband is a farmer. His income is 2,000,000 VND per month. To earn a living, Nam cooks food to sell as breakfast meals in the market. She has done her job for 11 years. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy ingredients to make food for her food stall. She always wants to earn more money for her family’s income so that she can help her children have good careers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food for her food stall.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary, who is 45 years old, is responsible and hardworking, and has the drive to succeed in order to have a better life. She lives with her husband and children, and helps provide them with their basic needs. Rosemary has a store where she sells household goods, personal use products and other items. Her business is very stable and generates a good amount of income, but she wants to improve her earnings by purchasing large quantities of basic necessities such flour, detergents, milk, beverages, and other items to sell to her customers. This will enable her to serve more people and improve her finances. She also sells fresh water from her home, serving the people who live in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is taking out another loan to expand her existing business. She has seen the need to continue to be in business since there has been demand for more variety of merchandise over the past few weeks. She is taking this advantage so that she can increase sales. 

Silvia is a determined woman who has the urge to move forward. Since the previous loan, her business and living standards have been positively affected. The new investment will allow her buy flour, sugar, salt, tea leaves, and other small fast-selling products.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar, salt, tea leaves, and other small fast-selling products.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose's group is comprised of  hard-working women. Rose is 23 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past year, Rose has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, sugar, and other items like soap. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of     500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase rice, sugar  and soap, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and help get more profits to pay for her children's education. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to get a bigger business. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar  and soap

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan was born in 1972. She has two children who are learning at high school and university. Her husband collects scrap metal and gets 4,500,000 VND. Loan makes tofu to earn a living. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,500,000 VND per month. 

Loan has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy chicken breeds and feed for raising them. She always wants to earn more money for her family’s income and to be able to let her children have good careers.

loans.use: to buy chicken breeds and feed for raising them.

loans.name: Chien

texts.en:
Chien was born in 1979. She has two children who are learning in the 10th grade and 5th grade. She is divorced from her husband. She cooks food for a small restaurant to earn a living. She gets 4,000,000 VND a month. This number is also the amount of her family’s total income per month. 

Chien has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 6,048,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy chicken breeds and feed for raising them. She always wants to earn more money for her family’s income so she can let her children have good careers.

loans.use: to buy chicken breeds and feed for raising them.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 34 year old Lebanese man. He is married and lives with his wife and three children, all of whom attend school. He and his wife are doing their best to increase the family's income and pay their children’s heavy school fees. Ahmad began working on his own as a blacksmith a few years ago, after he learned this profession through nine years of experience in the business.  He decided to work on his own to improve and develop himself. As he wants to enlarge his business and get more work, he decided to take out a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase supplies of metal and an electric generator. This will facilitate his work and allow him take on bigger projects. Ahmad’s greatest dream is to educate his children well and see them achieve higher positions in life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies of metal and an electric generator.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina continua en el banco comunal “Imasumac II”, además con la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien.  Solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para su chacra. Ella esta agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Luz Marina continues to be a member of the communal bank "Imasumac II," and she also continues to work in agriculture and raise small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She has now worked in this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for her. She is applying for the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es: Maria Cleofe continúa en el banco comunal “Imasumac II” y con el negocio de venta de verduras. Ella vende verduras en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco. Su jornada empieza desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m. Por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos. Su sueño es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de verduras. Solicita el crédito para comprar tomates, cebollas, zanahorias y zapallos. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Cleofe continues to be a member of the Imasumac II community bank.  She also continues her business selling vegetables.  She sells vegetables at one of the markets in the city of Cusco.  Her day starts at 8:00am and goes until 6:00pm.  This business has helped her improve the lives of her children.  Her dream is to expand and improve her vegetable sales business.

She is requesting this loan to purchase tomatoes, onions, carrots, and pumpkins.  She is happy with this loan and promises make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, carrots, and pumpkin.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda continúa en el banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” y trabaja en una entidad pública, además ella cría de animales menores como cuyes y los vende en los diferentes mercados y ferias de la ciudad del Cusco. Con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios. En esta oportunidad Hilda requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: HIlda continues to be a member of the communal bank "Siempre Juntos" (Always Together). She works for a public agency, and she also raises small animals such as guinea pigs and sells them in different markets and fairs in the city of Cusco. The previous loan went very well for her, and she was able to obtain good earnings. Now she needs a loan to buy more guinea pigs. She is happy about the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos continúa en el banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” y trabaja como técnico dental, él tiene un pequeño laboratorio dental donde elabora piezas dentales. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como: yeso, acrílicos, alambres y otras cosas más. Este agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Carlos continues to be a member of the communal bank "Siempre Juntos" (Always Together) and to work as a dental technician. He has a small dental laboratory where he makes dental pieces. At this time he needs a loan to buy working materials such as plaster, acrylics, wires, and other additional items. He is grateful for the loan and promises to make his payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy plaster, acrylics, wires, and other additional items.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma continua en el banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” y trabaja elaborando hamburguesas, sándwich, jugos, además vende todo tipo de productos de snack y bebidas heladas, ella continua con su puesto de venta en uno de los colegios de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería como: dulces, empanadas, gelatinas, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates e insumos para la elaboración de los diversos sándwiches como: pollo, pan, salsas y otras cosas más. Esta agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
Vilma continues as a member of the Siempre Juntos community bank.  She works making hamburgers, sandwiches, and juices as well as selling all types of snacks products and cold drinks.  She continues at her sales post at one of the high schools in the city of Cusco.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise such as candy, empanadas, gelatins, sodas, cookies, chocolates, and ingredients to make different sandwiches such as chicken, bread, salsas, and other items.  She is grateful for the opportunity to take this loan since it will allow her to invest in her business and grow financially.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as candy, empanadas, gelatins, sodas, cookies, chocolates, and ingredients to make different sandwiches such as chicken, bread, salsas, and other items.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is 17 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar, salt and oil. To help expand her business, she is requesting a loan for 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more products to sell, including sugar. This will help Robinah generate greater profits and expand her store. She hopes to own a big business in the future.  

Robinah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as sugar.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydeee continúa en el banco comunal “Imasumac II”, en el negocio de venta de comida y venta de helados. Ella prepara diferentes tipos de comida típicas de la región del Cusco además elabora helados. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  Por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos y su sueño es sacar profesionales a sus hijos. 

Solicitó el crédito para comprar insumos como: sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz, tarros de leche y galletas al por mayor. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Haydee continues to be a member of the community bank “Imasumac II” and runs a business selling food and ice cream.  She makes many types of traditional foods from the Cusco region and in addition, she makes ice cream.  For the past few years, she has been in this line of work and things are going well for her.  By means of this business, she is able to support her children's growth, and her dream is to make her children into college educated professionals.

She asked for this loan to buy products like sacks of sugar, sacks of rice, jars of milk, and cookies at wholesale prices.  She is happy with the loan and promises that she will make payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy basic products like sugar, jugs of milk, and other items.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is 22 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, she has been working hard to manage her business, where she sells clothing for babies. To help expand her business, Cissy has requested a loan for 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more garments to sell, and this will allow her to develop her business and earn more profits. Her goal for the future is to expand the size of her business.  

Cissy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more garments to sell.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor continua en el banco comunal “Imasumac II” y en el negocio de crianza de animales como: cuyes, pollos y chanchos. Ella hace crecer y engordar a los animales para luego los vende en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad del Cusco. Su jornada de trabajo empieza desde las 9:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m. de lunes a sábados. Por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. Su sueño es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales. Solicitó el crédito para comprar alimentos y animales como chanchos, cuyes y pollos. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Leonor continues to be a member of the community banking group “Imasumac II” and is in the business of raising animals like guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs.  She grows them and fattens the animals and then sells them at different markets in the city of Cusco.  Her work day begins at 9:00 a.m. and runs until 5:00 p.m. Monday through Saturday.  By means of this business, she is able to help support her children's growth.  Her dream is to expand and improve her animal farming business.  She is asking for a loan to buy food and animals like pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens.  She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.
﻿﻿

loans.use: to buy food and animals like pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens.

loans.name: Rigoberto Linder

texts.es: Rigoberto Linder continua en el banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” pues es una persona responsable y amable, él es policía y sus jornales laborales empieza desde muy temprano en la calles de la cuidad brindando seguridad a la población y poniendo el orden. Solicita el préstamo para uso personal como: comprar artefactos y mantenimiento de la casa. Esta feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rigoberto Linder continues as a member of the Siempre Juntos community bank.  He is a responsible and kind person.  He works as a policeman and his daily work starts very early in the streets of the city.  He provides security to the people and maintains order.  

He is asking for this loan for personal use.  He wants to purchase appliances and perform maintenance on his home.  He is happy with this loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase appliances and maintain his home.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a 34-year-old, married woman. She has three children, whose ages range from 4 years to 12 years. She describes herself as a determined woman. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a viable business area, and her primary customers are local residents from the environs. She says her biggest business challenge is inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more clothes to resell. Her business goal is to be selling new clothes within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will pay school fees with profits generated from the business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is 35 years old, and lives in his own house with his family.  He is a divorced father of two children, who are in school.

Allan has a grocery store in his home, which he runs himself. His store sells baked goods, soft drinks, cleaning products and foodstuffs.  Thanks to this business, he and his family have moved forward in life, and can support their household and pay any unforeseen expenses.

With the loan, he wishes to expand his business in order to satisfy the needs of his customers. He will buy more baked goods, soft drinks, cleaning products and foodstuffs to offer a variety to his customers.

loans.use: buy more baked goods, soft drinks, cleaning products and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 26-year-old married woman; she has a child. She describes herself to be a innovative and hard-working woman. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services; she has been involved in this business for 4 years. 

Her business is located at a viable and potential business area, and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy a blow drier. 

Her business goal is to run a manufacturing shop, selling hair products, within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will run a similar beauty salon. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a blow drier for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Ghiwa

texts.en:
Ghiwa is a 30 year old Lebanese married woman. She’s living with her parents and two school aged children because of her husband’s crucial work outside the country. 

In 2008, she started her own business selling accessories and traditional clothes from her house. Her income is important in supporting her husband, who works nonstop to be able to satisfy his family's needs and pay his children's study fees. Her husband works at a company that he has spent almost fifteen years in. 

Today, Ghiwa is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her inventory of accessories and traditional clothes. Her intention at this stage is to augment her sales so as to amplify her income. In the future, she is planning to open her own shop.

loans.use: to expand her inventory of accessories and traditional clothes.

loans.name: Immaculate's Group

texts.en:
Immaculate's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Immaculate is 22 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past three years, Immaculate has been working hard to manage her clothing business, in which she sells babies' and ladies' wear.

To help expand her business, Immaculate has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to expand the business, and will help Immaculate to generate greater profits. She will use the profits to buy the things her children need. Immaculate hopes that in the future she will be able to increase the business further. 

Immaculate is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to expand the business.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 27 years old, engaged to be married and lives in Lebanon. Today, he lives at home with his parents and two siblings. One sibling is attending school while the other has started his own business. Mahmoud is the family's main source of income. He has owned a cafe since 2006, and serves hubble-bubble, a traditional Lebanese tobacco. His cafe draws a wide range of clients from his village and nearby areas. Today, he is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy tobacco and hubble-bubble equipment. In the future, he plans to take out another loan from Kiva so that he can build a special tent next to his shop where he can start preparing fast food and welcome customers who want to relax and enjoy some free time.

loans.use: to buy tobacco and equipment for a cafe.

loans.name: Volonte Divine 3 Group

texts.en:
Joel, age 41, is married with 2 children, ages 2 and 18. His 18 year old is currently attending school. He is representing the Volonte Divine 3 group. 

Joel owns and operates a hardware store. He has had this business for 12 years, and has gained loyal customers over the years. He plans to use the loan to buy merchandise for his store, including nails, wood, and screws. 

He has received 4 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He would like to build a large hardware store one day. He hopes his children will study well in school, and be able to obtain good jobs.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise for his hardware store, including nails, wood, and screws.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 36-year-old married woman. She has two children, 6 and 10 years old. She describes herself to be a hardworking woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals such as maize, beans, etc. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located at a viable business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high transportation costs. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy ten bags of maize to sell. Her business goal is to export maize to other countries within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her farming business, which she does in her leisure time. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of maize

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal BATAN ORCCO,la socia tiene 75 años ,casada y tiene 7 hijos, la socia Carmen Isabel alterna su actividades diarias con el negocio de panadería, la socia cuenta con su propio horno donde elabora diferentes tipos de panes para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes que le solicitan ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo e esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su  familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, trigo y leña para su horno.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Carmen Isabel is a member of the Batan Orcco community bank.  She is 75 years old, married, and has seven children.  She balances her daily activities with working at her bakery.  She has her own oven where she makes different types of bread to distribute to her customers who order it.  She has had this business for many years and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts in every day.  She is a responsible and hardworking and this is how she has improved her family's life.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies such as flour, wheat, and firewood for her oven.  She is grateful for the loan provided and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as flour, wheat, and firewood for her oven.

loans.name: Club De Amigas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CLUB DE AMIGAS”  iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eugenia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de chompas tejidas, tejido de chompas, venta de ganado, venta de enaguas y faldas, costura de deportivos, tienda de aceitería, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eugenia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de nuestra institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace años, empezando su comercio con el negocio de venta de papa y chuño posteriormente observó que el negocio de verduras era más prospero y lo cambio ya que tenía pensado comprarse un terreno.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el servicio médico.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Club de Amigas” (Club of Friends) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center.  This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Eugenia as its president.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling woven sweaters, weaving sweaters, selling livestock, selling petticoats and skirts, manufacturing sportswear, managing a store that sells oil, and selling vegetables.  

This loan will benefit small businesswomen, such as Sra. Eugenia, who is a member of this group.  This is the first time she has joined a group with Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from one of the organization’s promoters.  Eugenia currently manages a business of selling vegetables.  She started her business years ago through her own initiative. Eugenia initially sold regular and dried potatoes, but she saw that it was more profitable to sell vegetables.  Since making that change, she now has plans to buy a plot of land.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying vegetables.  Eugenia acquires her products wholesale at the fairs within the city of El Alto and then sells them at her vending stall.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income so that she can support her household.  Eugenia is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Eugenia said that she enjoys the training classes and the health services.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
There are always hard and difficult moments in life, but the desire for self-improvement always arises to cause one to seek a better future. Esther is a clear example of this. She lives with her life companion and they are highly motivated to reach their goals and not defeated by adversities that arise.
 
She’s a hard-working, honest woman who has good relationships in her neighborhood. She sells dried maize at the market. She’s gradually attained customers who prefer her, which is why she’d like to buy more merchandise. Unfortunately, she does not have sufficient capital to make this investment. She approached Yehu to request a loan to buy more sacks of maize to resell. She is grateful for the support she hopes to get, and she promises that she’ll repay the loan, while at the same time, she is confident that she’ll provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of maize for sale.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 55-year-old married Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and three children, two of whom work. They cooperate with their father Hussein to improve their status financially in order to live in better conditions. Hussein has been working as a photographer since 2000. He works on his own, photographing events such as weddings, parties, concerts, and many other special occasions. He is professional and well-known in his town and the surrounding areas. Today, he is applying for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a video camera for his business. Clients always ask for video, and this will be a great step for Hussein to be able to take on more events and increase his earnings. One of his greatest dreams is to be known outside the country, so that he can grow his business and earn higher profits.

loans.use: to purchase a video camera

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is married and lives in Panglao, Bohol. She has three children who are six, four and two years old. For the last two years, she has earned a living by raising hogs. She earns about PHP 3,000 a month and is requesting a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy additional piglets and feed for them to eat. In the future, Juliet would like to invest in other ventures so that she can support her family and save for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed for them to eat.

loans.name: María Yolanda

texts.es:
María tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y cuenta con dos hijos en edad escolar, vive en casa propia junto a su familia. Vive en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola en donde la mayoría de familias son de condición humilde. Su hogar cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, su comunidad está conformada por un aproximado de 200  familias.

La actividad que desarrolla es la crianza y comercialización de animales, esta actividad la realiza desde hace cuatro años, el negocio esta situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, por lo que conoce a la perfección el rubro. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad de sirven para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de pavos medianos para su engorde y posterior venta en Navidad.

Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización, lo que garantiza la correcta devolución del dinero prestado. Ella agradece de antemano a las personas que le ayuden a sacar adelante su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 27-years-old, is married, and has two children that are school of school age. She lives in her own home with her family. She lives in the rural zone of the district of Mórrope, an agricultural zone where most of the families come from humble conditions. Her home counts on water and light services. Her community is comprised of approximately 200 families. 

The activity that she works in is the raising and sale of animals. This activity she has done for 4 years. The business is located her home. She learned this activity from her parents for what she knows perfectly is the item. 

The income that she earns in this activity helps her husband to financially sustain the family. She finds herself requesting a loan of 100 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa that she hopes to invest in the purchase of medium sized Turkeys to gain weight and resell for Christmas. 

This business counts on the competition and also counts on the large market for her commercialization. This guarantees the correct return of the money lent. She is grateful in advance to the people that will help her to get her business ahead.

loans.use: to purchase medium turkeys to gain weight and resell for Christmas

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Robert tiene 28 años, es conviviente y vive junto a su familia en  Lambayeque, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.  En su comunidad la mayoría son trabajadores independientes en negocios de comercio y crianza de animales adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura.

Robert se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, además de trabajar como empleado en un molino.  Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años, tiempo en el cual ha adquirido mucha experiencia en el negocio, además de muchos clientes, quienes son mayormente comerciantes de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Robert quiere realizar arreglos en su domicilio, comenzando a enlucir sus paredes y levantando nuevas piezas con material noble, además de comprar una refrigeradora. Esto le permitirá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.  Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Robert is 28 years old and lives with his family in Lambayeque, located 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque.  In his community the majority of people work independently in commercial businesses and raise animals or work in agriculture.

Robert works raising and selling animals, as well as working as an employee at a mill.  He has been working in this field for 5 years.  In that time he has acquired a lot of experience in the business, as well as many customers, who are mostly business people in the city of Chiclayo.  

Robert wants to make some improvements to his home, beginning with whitewashing his walls and putting up new walls as well as buy a refrigerator.  This will allow him to give his family a better quality of life.  In order to achieve his objective he is asking for credit from Edpyme Alternativa, a Kiva field partner, in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency).

loans.use: to whitewash his walls and purchase a new refrigerator

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
This is Majida, 41, a resident of Lebanon. She’s married to Salman, a very kind man. They live with their three school-aged children in one of the old villages of Lebanon. They live a very modest life, especially after suffering a bad financial situation. 

Salman is the main source of income for the family, and seeks to offer them a fair way of living.  As for Majida, she has opened a juice and cake shop. She has owned this shop for nine years. She’s satisfied with the results attained so far, and always seeks to improve her business. 

She's requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new refrigerator so she can maintain fresh cake in good conditions. She notes that this will allow her to serve a wider range of people and increase her revenues. 

In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans to expand her business and hopefully boost her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator to maintain the condition of her product for her cake and juice shop.

loans.name: Les Fideles 2 Group

texts.en:
Yvette, age 48, is married with 5 children, ages 10 to 25. She has 4 children currently attending school. She also provides for her 10-year-old niece. 

Yvette is representing the Les Fideles 2 group. She owns a small business where she sells water; she has been in business for 7 years. 

Yvette will use the loan to buy more water to resell. In Congo, some months water is more expensive than in others. This capital gives Yvette flexibility in how she purchases her water throughout the year. 

Yvette has received 1 previous loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo, and she did well with her first loan. She hopes to continue to grow her business and provide a good life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for water to resell.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is 17 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono Region of Uganda. For the past two years, Bridget has been working hard to manage her shop, which sells clothing. 

To help expand her business, Bridget has requested a loan of  300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Bridget to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Bridget hopes that in the future she will be able to develop the business. 

Bridget is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Janjay

texts.en: Janjay, 40, stopped her education in the ninth grade. She is married and lives in Buchanan with her husband and three children who are between the ages of 9 and 18. All of them are currently in school. For the past fifteen years now, she has been selling ladies' slippers, ladies' underwear, earrings, and chains for women. Because she sells goods, she makes a profit every day. With the profit generated from the business, she buys more goods and contributes to the family's expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ladies' slippers, ladies' underwear, and earrings for her business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' slippers, ladies' underwear, and earrings

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina's group is comprised of hard-working women. Regina is 23 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, 1 of whom is currently in school. For the past 2 years, Regina has been working hard to manage her fish vending business, which sells fish and matooke. 

To help expand her business, Regina has requested a loan of 400000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. Regina will use this loan to get more food and fish to sell, allowing her to generate greater profits and helping her supply her basic needs from those profits. Regina hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her business. 

Regina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to get more food and fish to sell.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine is a married woman of 24 years, but is not yet blessed with any children. She is a determined woman, who has the urge to make progress in life. 

Currently, she is asking for a loan to open a vegetable stall. She is very optimistic that she will earn a good income out of this investment. She is requesting this loan to purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices.

Maurine is a responsible client, who is very active.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Les Dix Commandements 1 Group

texts.en:
Durel, age 31, is single and has no children, but he provides for his 7-year-old nephew and 19-year-old sister. He is representing the Les Dix Commandements 1 group. 

Durel has a game room where customers come to play video and computer games. He also sells phone cards at his game room. He has been operating this business for three years. As many people do not have their own game consoles in Congo they go to games rooms that provide the TV, console, and a variety of games. These are very popular around Brazzaville. He plans to use the loan to buy phone cards and more video games in order to keep an up-to-date variety for his customers to play. 

Durel has received three previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He aims to buy other games shops around the city as he expands.

loans.use: to pay for video games and phone cards for his business

loans.name: Les Dix Commandements 2 Group

texts.en:
Sylvie, 35, is a single mother of 2-year-old twins. She is representing the Les Dix Commandements 2 group. She has a grocery shop where she sells food and household products. She also has a small butcher shop where she sells different cuts of chicken, beef, and fish. She has been operating these businesses for 7 years. 

Sylvie plans to use her loan to replenish the merchandise in her grocery shop. She wants to buy a variety of dishes and drinks. Her business strategy is to market her business on signs and in local magazines and newspapers. Sylvie has received 3 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to continue to grow her businesses and begin traveling abroad to purchase merchandise. She wants to begin importing items in the future.

loans.use: to pay for dishes and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Romula

texts.en:
Romula is a 55-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She has two children aged 13 and 18. She has been in the food-vending business for 26 years. She cooks and sells viands in her community. 

Romula has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase rice, soft drinks, vegetables, and meat. In the future, she would like to invest in other ventures to have a sustainable livelihood while saving for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, vegetables, and meat

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Очень хороший человек, который всегда старается помогать близким и знакомым, находится в финансовом недостатки и нуждается вашей поддержки. Его зовут Шухрат и ему 35 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 3 года назад он начал свой бизнес с куплей головного убора. Его эффективность помогает ему быть успешным в бизнесе. Он продает свой товар на местном рынке и имеет большой круг клиентов. Он должен купить товар для нового сезона, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони  для покупки товара для нового сезона. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте, ему поможем держать свой стимул среди бизнесменов.
texts.en: A very good man who always helps his friends and loved ones is experiencing a financial shortfall and needs your support.  His name is Shuhrat and he is 35 years old.  He is married and has one child at home.  With the goal of providing for his family's needs, he started his own business selling hats three years ago.  His effectiveness helps him enjoy success in his business.  Shuhrat sells his goods at a local market and has a large circle of clients.  He needs to buy hats for the new season, but he doesn't have enough money for this.  He is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy goods for the new season.  He is awaiting your kindness.  Let's help him maintain his incentive among his fellow businessmen.

loans.use: To buy headwear for the new season

loans.name: Los Cocos Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Santito Alejandra que se dedica a vender mercadería en general como ropa variada unisex, ropa interior, cosméticos, calzados en su comunidad. Utiliza medio tiempo para la venta de sus productos y medio tiempo trabaja como domesticas en una vivienda privada para aportar en los gastos de su familia. El crédito lo utilizara en la compra de ropa variada, cosméticos, calzados, ropa interior, etc. Edipcia vende mercadería en general en su comunidad los vende, Xiomara tiene un tramo de ropa usada en el mercado.
texts.en:
This group consists of three entrepreneurs. One of them is Santito Alejandra. She sells general merchandise such as unisex clothing, undergarments, cosmetics, and shoes in her community. Santito spends part of her time selling these products and the rest of her time is devoted to her job as a housekeeper at a private residence. This enables her to maintain her family’s expenses. Her loan will be used to buy various clothing, cosmetics, shoes, undergarments, and other products.

Edipcia sells general merchandise in her community while Xiomara has a vending stall at the market where she sells used clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, shoes, undergarments, and other products.

loans.name: Peace And Unity Group

texts.en:
Alusine is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Alusine was born in Makeni City about 35 years ago. He is married to a caterer.  Alusine sells mobile phones and mobile phone accessories. He has been a businessman for 12 years now. 

With the help of this loan, Alusine and his group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Alusine will use his share of the loan (1,000,000 leones) to buy a larger number of mobile phones to add to his current ones.

loans.use: to buy a larger number of mobile phones to add to his current ones.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is a 38-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She has three children; the oldest is 14 and the youngest is 3 years old. Crispina sells puto (rice cake) and cuchinta (a type of kakanin; kakanins are Philippines’ native delicacies and are snacks usually made with coconut, coconut milk, rice flour, glutinous rice, or cassava). 

Crispina has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy rice flour, sugar, coconut milk, and glutinous rice. In the future, she would like to expand her business to support her family as well as save for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy rice flour, sugar, coconut milk, and glutinous rice

loans.name: Redempteur 2 Group

texts.en:
Roberte, age 49, is a single mother of four children aged 8 to 25 years old. Three of her children currently attend school. She also provides for her 18-year-old niece. Roberte is representing the Redempteur 2 group. 

Roberte sells soft drinks and juice and has been operating this small business for six years. She will use her portion of the loan to buy a large stock of drinks to sell. Her business strategy is to buy her merchandise in bulk at a discounted price and sell it piece by piece. 

Roberte has received four previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. In the future, she wants to buy drinks from outside of Congo and import them to sell in her store. She hopes her children are able to find work after they are finished with school.

loans.use: to pay for soft drinks and juice to sell.

loans.name: Redempteur 1 Group

texts.en: Dominique, age 52, is married and has a 25 year-old child. He is representing the Redempteur 1 group. He owns a restaurant and has been operating it for 4 years. He will use the loan to buy food for his restaurant, including manioc, oil, and sacks of tomatoes. Manioc is a staple Congolese food that is made from the roots of local Casava plants. His business strategy is to market and promote his restaurant through flyers and posters. He also tries to improve the aesthetics of his restaurant and wants it to be inviting and pretty inside. Dominique has received 4 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. His next project will be to buy an ice cream machine for his restaurant.

loans.use: to pay for food for his restaurant, including manioc, oil, and sacks of tomatoes.

loans.name: La Richesse 3 (#2) Group

texts.en: Padou, age 24, is single and has no children, but he supports and cares for his four year old niece. He is representing the La Richesse 3 (#2) group. Padou owns a grocery stall in a local market, and has been operating it for five years. He sells various food and household products. He will use the loan to buy cans of sardines, milk, soap, and cookies. He has received 4 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a very good repayment record. He wants to have a large grocery store one day. He hopes his niece will continue her education as he supports her.

loans.use: to pay for cans of sardines, milk, soap, and cookies.

loans.name: Nishuuli

texts.en:
Nishuuli is 42 years old and is a native of the town of Tiribe.

She operates a business where she sells seasonal fruit and vegetables, and she has been in this business for over ten years. She explains that she works a lot, since this is her only source of income. Her business income is used to support herself and to cover her family's household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory by buying seasonal fruit and vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, kale, cabbages, bananas, etc. She is grateful to the institution for the support it has provided her.

loans.use: to expand inventory by purchasing additional fruit and vegetables (e.g., tomatoes, potatoes, kale, cabbages, and bananas)

loans.name: Andrés De Jesús

texts.es:
Don Andrés  tiene 65 años de edad, es casado. Es una persona luchadora y trabajadora, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 32 años, fue su padre quien le enseño ya que Vivian en una hacienda en donde trabaja día y noche. Él asiste a la iglesia, es pastor de la iglesia desde hace 25 años. Los insumos agrícolas los compra en una localidad que esta a veinte minutos en bicicleta. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar dos terneras para repasto y para pagar el alquiler de 14,000 metros cuadrados de terreno, para cultivar en la época de verano bajo el sistema de riego. Con la inversión tendrá seguro el lugar donde cultivara y podrá comprar más ganado que le ayude a generar mayores ingresos para su familia. Que le permita brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a sus nietas y poder salir de las limitaciones económicas en las que se encuentran.
texts.en:
Andrés is sixty-five years old and is married.  He is a hard-working and fighting individual, and has been making a living in agriculture for the past thirty-two years.  It was his father who taught him, since they lived on a ranch where he worked day and night.  He attends church and has been a leader of the church for twenty-five years.  He buys all his agricultural inputs in a small town that is twenty minutes away by bicycle. 

The loan he is requesting is to buy two calves for grazing and to pay the rent on 14,000 square meters of land that he will cultivate in the summer season with an irrigation system.  With this investment, he will know he has land to cultivate and will be able to buy more livestock that will help him generate a higher income for his family.  

This will allow him to provide better living conditions for his granddaughters, and to get out of the economic constraints in which they have found themselves.

loans.use: to buy two calves for grazing and to pay the rent on 14,000 square meters of land.

loans.name: Les Fideles 1 Group

texts.en: Julien, age 42, is single and has three children, ages 10 to 22 years old. He has two children currently in school. He is representing the Les Fideles 1 group. Julien owns a pharmacy and has had it for 19 years! He has gained many loyal customers. He plans to use the loan to buy medicine to stock his shelves. His business strategy is to offer friendly and helpful customer service. His customers often have questions about different medicines and he tries to assist them in any way. Julien has received one loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He did well with his first loan. He aims to operate a good pharmacy that serves the customers.

loans.use: to pay for medicine.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria is a 39 year old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has two children ages 12 and 17.  She owns a sari-sari (variety) store business. 

Aside from her sari-sari store, she sells chicken and meat barbecue.  She requested a loan of 5,000  PHP to purchase merchandise like noodles, canned goods, shampoo, and chicken and meat for barbecue. 

Hilaria would like to expand her business to invest in other ventures to support her family needs as well as to finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like noodles, shampoo, canned goods and meat.

loans.name: Qasem

texts.en: Qasem is 24 years old from Nablus.  He owns a small cafe in his village in which he has been serving hot drinks and hookah since 2009. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy used chairs and tables, develop the space of the cafe, and buy a water heater.  He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and improve his income and thus help him pay for his university tuition .

loans.use: to buy used chairs and tables, develop the space of the shop and buy a water heater.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina continúa en el banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” y trabajando como asistente en una veterinaria. Ella es una persona responsable y amable que sale adelante. Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo ósea va comprar inyectables, alimento, vitaminas y otras cosas más. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Marcelina continues in the “Siempre Juntos” (Always Together) communal bank and working as an assistant in a veterinary clinic.  She’s a responsible, kind person who gets ahead.  She’s requesting the loan to buy working materials, that is, injectables, feed, vitamins and others.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy injectables, feed, vitamins and others.

loans.name: David

texts.es: David continúa en el banco Comunal “Siempre Juntos” y trabaja en la crianza de animales menores. Él tiene varios cuyes y galpones (Lugar donde viven sus animales). En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes. Este agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: David continues in the “Siempre Juntos” (Always Together) communal and working raising small farm animals.  He has several guinea pigs and animal enclosures (places where his animals live).  On this occasion he needs the loan to buy guinea pigs.  He’s grateful for the loan and commits to make his installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Erlin Francisco

texts.es: El joven Erlin tiene de 30 años de edad, su compañera de vida es ama de casa y ambos tienen una hija de 7 años, el trabaja en la compra y venta de hierro usado, este primer crédito solicitado lo necesita para invertir en esta labor comprando mas hierro con lo que elabora cocinas que se usan con leña, carbón y estribos, trabajo que él solo realiza, antes contaba con ayuda de otras personas pero ahora es independiente y con los ingresos obtenidos ayuda a su familia e hija quien va a la escuela primaria, agradece esta oportunidad de préstamo para progresar en la vida.
texts.en: Young Erlin is 30-years-old and his life companion is a housewife; they have a 7-year-old daughter.  He works buying and selling used metal.  This is the first loan he’s asked for and he needs it to invest in his work buying more metal he uses to make wood-burning stoves, coal-burning stoves and stirrups.  This is work he does alone.   He used to have help from others but now he’s independent and uses income earned to help his family and daughter who is attending elementary school.  He’s grateful for the opportunity this loan gives him to make progress in life.

loans.use: to buy used metal.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: Ivan pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastian” de la ciudad del Cusco, él nació en la ciudad del cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 44 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos. Su esposa y él tienen un negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de productos de belleza para damas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar perfumes y colonias y por otra parte también es para uso personal para comprar ropa y víveres. Esta feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Ivan is a member of the community bank “Patrón de San Sebastian” from the city of Cusco.  He was born in the city of Cusco and still lives in that same city.  He is 44 hears old and married, and as a result of that beautiful relationship, he has two children.  He and his wife have a family business consisting of sales of beauty products for ladies.  At this time, he needs a loan to buy perfumes and colognes and the other part he plans to use fr personal expenses to buy clothing and groceries.  He is happy to receive this loan and promises that he will make the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and colognes and also for his own personal use.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es: Pamela pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella nació en la ciudad del cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Ella tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera es decir no tiene hijos. Su actividad económica principal es alquilar carros a diferentes personas que desean brindar servicio de taxi. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de los carros. Esta feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Pamela is a member of the communal bank “Patrón de San Sebastián” from the city of Cusco.  She was born in the city of Cusco and still lives in the city where she was born.  She is 22 years old and single, so she doesn't have any children.  Her primary business is car rental to people who want to offer taxi services.  At this time, she needs a loan to do maintenance work on the cars.  She is happy to have this loan and promises that she will make her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to do maintenance on cars.

loans.name: God Bless Business Group

texts.en:
Salamatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Salamatu was born in the town of Lunsar, in Northern Sierra Leone, 28 years ago. She is married to a trader. She and her husband have two children, who attend primary schools. For 15 years now, Salamatu has been selling plastic bowls and other plastic containers.

This would not the first loan these entrepreneurs have received from Kiva lenders. A previous Kiva loan created a huge impact in the lives and businesses of these borrowers. With the help of that loan, their businesses increased in size and improved in quality. Sales and profits also increased for these borrowers as a result of the increase in their business inventories.

Having successfully repaid that prior loan, they are again requesting a loan, this time in the amount of 1,200,000 SLL each (4,800,000 SLL total), to further improve and expand their businesses. Salamatu, the leader of this group, plans on using her share of the loan proceeds to buy more plastic containers in order to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to increase inventory by purchasing additional plastic containers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Le Progres 1 Group

texts.en: Genevieve, age 50, is a single mother. She has four children, ages 22 to 32 years old. She has 2 children currently attending school. She also provides and cares for two grandchildren and one nephew. Genevieve operates a restaurant and a small butcher shop. She has been doing this for 20 years! She has made a presence in her neighborhood over the years and gained loyal customers. She will use the loan to buy sacks of beans and rice, fish, chicken, tomatoes, foufou, and charcoal. Her business strategy is to put the customers first offering friendly customer service. Genevieve has received five previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She wants to continue to improve her business and use her profits to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for sacks of beans and rice, fish, chicken, tomatoes, foufou, and charcoal.

loans.name: Guevara Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth pertenece al banco comunal “Patron de San Sebastian” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella nació en la ciudad del cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de diferentes tipos de productos como jaboncillos, pasadores, cremas, cuerdas, lana y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería tal como betunes y jaboncillos. Esta feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Elizabeth’s a member of the “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  She was born in Cusco and still lives in the city of her birth.  She’s 43-years-old, married and has three children.  Her main economic activity is selling varied merchandise like small bars of soap, hair pins, creams, laces, yarn and other things.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy merchandise like shoe polish and small bars of soap.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like shoe polish and bars of soap.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria pertenece al banco comunal “Patron de San Sebastian” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella nació en la ciudad del cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Ella tiene 43 años de edad y tiene cuatro hijos. Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio internet es decir tiene una cabina de internet con varias computadoras donde sus clientes acceden a páginas web para hacer sus tareas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento preventivo de las computadoras. Esta feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Gloria’s a member of the “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in Cusco.  She was born in Cusco and still lives there.  She’s 43-years-old and has four children.  Her main economic activity is providing Internet access service, that is, she has an Internet access booth with several computers her customers use to access webpages to do their tasks.  On this occasion, she needs the loan to provide preventive maintenance service for the computers.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to service the computers.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella nació en la ciudad del cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Ella tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera es decir no tiene hijos. Su actividad económica principal es hacer diseños publicitarios. Ya son tres a cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien, también alquila habitaciones en su domicilio. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de las habitaciones. Esta feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Patricia is a member of the communal bank “Patrón de San Sebastián” in the city of Cusco.  She was born in that city and resides in the same city where she was born.  She is 25 years old and single, and therefore she has no children.  Her primary business activity is making designs for advertising.  It has been three to four years since she started in this line of work and it is going well.  She also rents rooms in her house.  At this time, she is in need of a loan to do maintenance work on the rooms.  She is happy about the loan and promises that she will make her payments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her rooms.

loans.name: Yobana Jakeline

texts.es: Yobana pertenece al banco comunal “Patron de San Sebastian” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella nació en la ciudad Santo Tomas pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco. Ella tiene 57 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos. Su actividad económica principal es alquilar departamentos o habitaciones. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de las habitaciones y departamentos o sea va pintar entonces va comprar pintura. Esta feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yobana’s a member of the “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in Cusco.  She was born in Santo Tomas but lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.  She’s 57-years-old, married and has two children.  Her main economic activity is renting apartments or rooms.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does very well.  On this occasion she needs the loan to repair the rooms and apartments, that is, she will buy paint.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy paint.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Ella tiene 39 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Ella tiene una constructora que realiza edificios, casas, calles y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para pagar los costos de los trámites para la contratación de obras del estado. Esta feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Rita’s a member of the “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  She was born in Cusco and still lives in the city of her birth.  She’s 39-years-old and is in a free union; she has two children.  She owns a construction firm that builds buildings, houses, streets and others.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does very well.  On this occasion she needs the loan to pay costs related to state construction.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to pay fees related to state construction projects.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia is a 32-year-old married woman living at West Point with her husband and their three children. Her children are between the ages of 8 and 12, and they currently attend school.

To earn a living, Felecia has a table in the market, where she has been selling various retail goods, such as rubber dishes, plates, cups, and spoons, for the past six years. She received the initial capital to start her business from her husband, and she learned how to sell goods from her mother. She likes this line of business because she is able to improve and expand her business with the profits she generates.

She is requesting this loan to purchase more goods so that she can increase her sales. In the future, she would like to be able to provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to increase sales by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., rubber dishes, plates, spoons and cups)

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Mariam is a 20-year-old married woman living in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She and her husband have one child, who is currently in school. For the past two years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her clothes store, where she sells ladies' clothing.

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan in the amount of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds will be used to purchase more clothes, which she expects will help her generate more profits. In the future, Mariam hopes that saving such profits will enable her to build a home for her family.

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to increase sales by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is 49 years old and lives in Gaza. He is married and has two children who are at school. He has owned a grocery store since 2010 and has five years' experience in this business. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy goods and food for his store. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and thus meet the needs of his wife and children and help them build their future homes.

loans.use: to buy goods and food for his store.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en: Shadrack is a farmer in the Nyamira area of South Rift Kenya. He has been in farming for eight years. His main products are milk, maize, tea and beans. He gets additional income from a teaching job, where he earns 10,000 KES on a monthly basis. He is married with one child aged three years. Shadrack has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. He says that farming loans are a great help to smallholder farmers and will help improve his living standards. In the future, he plans to buy more parcels of land for better farming practices. He laments poor road networks and lack of good markets locally.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en: Abeer is 37 years old and lives in Nablus. She is married and has three children: two girls and a boy. She has owned an embroidery shop since 2006, and she has 10 employees. She asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy two new sewing machines, which will increase her production and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy two new sewing machines.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes, 31, is a mother of five children that are between the ages of 2 and 18, and all of them are attending school. Her husband is a driver, and he gave her the initial capital of $3,000 LD to start this business. A difficulty she faces is transporting the coal from the bush to Monrovia. With the profit, she will buy more goods and help her husband with the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal in bulk to sell. Her plan for the future is to become an international business woman.

loans.use: To purchase more coal in bulk sell

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. Él nació en la ciudad del cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Él tiene 49 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos. Él trabaja como coordinador de entrega de combustible además crea programas informáticos. Por otra parte su esposa y él tienen un negocio familiar que consiste en brindar servicio de internet. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar accesorios de computadoras como mouse, memorias, teclados, parlantes, auriculares y otras cosas más. Esta feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Ricardo belongs to the communal bank “Patrón de San Sebastián” in the city of Cusco.  He is a native of that city and lives in the same city where he was born.  He is 49 years old and married, as a result of that beautiful relationship, he has 4 children.  He works as a fuel deliveries coordinator and he also creates computer software.  On the side, he and his wife have a family business consisting of internet services.  At this moment, he is in need of a loan to buy computer accessories like a mouse, memory, keyboards, speakers, headphones, and other items.  He is happy about the loan and promise that he will make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories such as a mouse, memory, keyboards, speakers, headphones, and other items.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella nació en la ciudad del cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Ella tiene 65 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene seis hijos. Su actividad económica principal es vender golosinas en uno de los terminales terrestres de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como: dulces, chicles, galletas, gaseosas y otras cosas más. Esta feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Rosario belongs to the communal bank “Patrón de San Sebastián” from the city of Cusco.  She was born in the city of Cusco and lives in that same city where she was born.
